AND FALLS AWAY TO THE GROUND 100 FEET BELOW.
LANDS HARD, SMASHING INTO SOME SCAFFOLDING--
A_GHASTLY WHITE FACE SUDDENLY FLASHES PAST HIM-
WITH THE SUDDEN DEPRESSURIZATION EVERYTHING IS BEING
THE CARGO LIFT LURCHES UP AS--
THEN IT SLASHES AT PRIVATE COLE
THE ALIEN IS BLOWN OUT OF THE ENGINE--
THE INNER STEEL JAWS SLAM FORWARD
SOMETHING GOT ON BOARD. SOME KIND
ON THE INSIDE OF HIS HELMET-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peaceful slow DARKNESS. Soon shattered by violence. The birth of a new star. Cosmic dust floats, moving faster now, spiralling into an inner, spinning core. FLASHES like heat lightning, until hydrogen in the center IGNITES, bursting into BRIGHT FLAM A SHOCKWAVE ripples out, CRASHING PAST US, OBLITERATING

dialogues.speaker: EVERYTHING-
dialogues.text: Then we jump to a wider view. We see the vast explosion is a tiny puff, the new star am many stars. All is still and quiet. The serene ocean of space. Until a TINY OBJECT whips past the edge of a nebula. We find it, closing in on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COVENANT. A COLONY SHIP; built for speed and distance. The STARS AR HER DISTORT, gravity LENSING as the ship moves faster tha light.

dialogues.speaker: TITLES
dialogues.text: Deep-Space Colony Ship COVENANT

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGERS
dialogues.text: MISSION: Terraform and Populate DESTINATION: Origae-6 DATE: 2103, 239 light-years from Earth The COVENANT is 500 meters long. The long central body of ship is made of self-contained MODULES, like wagons in a wagon train. Jutting from the central body are three domi areas: INTERSTELLAR DRIVE; CREW MODULE; TERRAFORMING BAY.

dialogues.speaker: THE NURSERY
dialogues.text: Like being inside a gigantic snow globe. A gentle SNOW fa Everything encrusted in a light frost.  2. In the darkened PASSENGER CRYO-STASIS HOLD, a kiosk beeps awakens. NAMES SPELL OUT on a screen crusted in ice. Dim green light flickers out over 3600 CRYO-PODS, under the t blanket of SNOW ... The thousands of pods sweep up along huge curved wall, defying gravity. We see the FROZEN FACES of... WOMEN, MEN, CHILDREN ... Al banks of EMBRYOS at various stages... The kiosk finishes the inventory, the female COMPUTER VOI speaks:

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: 7 o’clock. All’s well. Ship’s BELL rings. The displays flicker out. All goes dar

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: EMPTY and DARK until... Blinders on the bridge windows OP DISTANT SUNLIGHT spills over captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: TERRAFORMING BAY
dialogues.text: A gigantic, shadowy chamber. Enormous VEHICLES. Earth-mov trucks and machines. Clamped and tethered in position. Po and waiting like silent dinosaurs.

dialogues.speaker: CREW SLEEP BAY
dialogues.text: 14 HYPER-SLEEP PODS. Dancing readouts indicate the health status of the sleeping CREW. We note something different about this sleep bay: all the pods are set in pairs. Two by two, like Noah’s Ark.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: We CREEP DOWN A LONG HALL, we hear... someone WHISTLING..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large room, tables, cooking equipment. Where the senior c congregates. One wall is a dramatic VERTICAL GARDEN that slopes up elegantly from the floor. Fruits, vegetables, greenery fo oxidation. Hydroponic pools on various tiers. SOMEONE tends the garden, whistling. Back to us. On his knees, planting a seedling. His hands are delicate, loving. This man cares about livi things.  3. He glances up as he wipes some condensation from his brow Is it DAVID? The android from Prometheus? No. It’s WALTER. An android who looks identical to David. Only his hair is dark and combed differently. We hear MOTHER, the computer:

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: That’s a fallacy, you know.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: That music facilitates plant growth.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why do you think I was whistling to the plant? He stands and cleans his hands. Proud of his work.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: It’s time to recharge the energy grid. Let’s be about it, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Nag, nag, nag.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Mother knows best. He smiles, goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves through the corridors, playing with the little b of dirt on his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Do you not like whistling?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I like efficiency. He moves into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flicker on as Walter moves to one of the contr consoles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be more to life than efficiency.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Not for machines, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (sotto) Bitch. He settles into the controls and goes to work, keying in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GLOWING BALL OF ENERGY that powers the INTERSTELLAR D dims, and the optical ripple around the ship settles, as CONVENTIONAL DRIVES FLARE into life. The COVENANT swings into orbit around the METHANE-BLUE IC GIANT. Then... The ship's huge ENERGY COLLECTION SAILS UNFURL, silvery, diaphanous... Now, the amazing ship is something new: beautiful. The Majestic sails give it the romantic feel of a mighty Gall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant SUN and the GAS GIANT, the edges of COLLECTIO SAILS visible. Walter sits, feet up. Looking at that last bit of dirt on fingertips. He blows it away, something poignant and huma the tiny act.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Walter. We may have a problem... A strong neutrino burst was detected in sector 106. It was weak, but it could trigger a larger event... On the HOLO NAV DISPLAY Walter ZOOMS IN on the NEBULA, se FLARES here, there... ...then a MUCH LARGER FLARE. His calm eyes suddenly anxio

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Channel all reserve power to the magnetic shielding and retract the sails--  5. But then the DISTANT NEBULA EXPLODES into BLINDING LIGHT, bridge filling with a loud radio-electric HISS as outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive SHOCKWAVE of CHARGED PARTICLES roils through th system. The IONOSPHERE of the GAS GIANT ignites with CRACKLING AURORAE as-- The SHOCKWAVE SLAMS INTO THE COVENANT-—

dialogues.speaker: THE COVENANT ROLLS VIOLENTLY-
dialogues.text: The sails on one side SHRED, BURN, as the entire ship lur dangerously--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter staggers to his feet, momentarily blinded. ALARMS sounding. The HOLO-MAP FLICKERS, WAVERS. But Walter is android-calm as he flips at high speed thro DAMAGE REPORTS on a HOLO MAP of the CRAFT--

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Multiple system failures in need of attention, but overall structural integrity was maintained during the incident--

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I know, Mother. Please initiate emergency crew revival. And I'1l need-— His eyes narrow on a BLINKING DAMAGE REPORT FROM THE NURS

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Fuck. He bolts--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter runs flat-out, no apparent exertion, an android’s amazing mechanical speed-- Meanwhile--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS gasps painfully--  6. She bolts awake, slamming into the closed plastic lid of sleep pod-- Her hands batter up at it as it slowly opens. She wrenche herself up and out and into-- Chaos. Most of the pods are already open. Others are opening. Th crew can be seen, kneeling, on the floor, puking, sweatin and shaking-- Sparks and flashing emergency lights. Smoke. The din of s klaxons-- DANIELS is disoriented -- there’s someone shaking her--

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Daniels, we -- Can you hear me...?! ORAM -- intense, sternly commanding -- is at her side, he little better than she is, sweating and ill--

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: For fuck sake, wake up! There was a power surge and-- TENNESSEE -- her old friend -- helps pull her up--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Come on, darlin’, Jacob’s in trouble. Jacob needs us-- At that, she spins-- The pod next to her, her husband's pod, has been damaged- It's crackling with sparks and smoking inside. Daniels cl at it. She can see her husband's face. He’s still asleep, twitching in pain.

dialogues.speaker: GET IT OPEN
dialogues.text: Daniels and Tennessee wrench at the pod to open it. Oram tries all the electrical commands: sparks explode. Growin panic. Her husband's face twitches more in pain. SERGEANT LOPE quickly joins them -- he’s a soldier, muscu steady and responsible--

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Stand back!  He SLAMS at the pod’s lock mechanism uselessly with an emergency fire axe-- Inside the pod, more sparks, and smoke-- And then fire! Daniels flings herself on the pod, clawing desperately-- Inside-- Her husband’s eyes snap open. They lock eyes. For one moment. Everything is very still. Then-- The pod is filled with flames. He’s incinerated before he eyes. Under her hands. She SCREAMS. Tennessee wrenches her away from the pod and folds her in his body, comforting. Oram and Sergeant Lope step back. Defeated, emotional. Or sinks to the ground. His wife -- KARINE -- comforts him. Silence in the room, everyone watching. Then the pod’s fire retardant kicks in. Filling it with a blast of steam. So we can no longer see the horror within

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter bolts in at top speed-- Screeches to a stop. His worst fears realized. One of the sections of sleeping pods has COLLAPSED. Falle on itself. A terrible image of sparks and shattered pods dead cold BODIES. Death has come to the Covenant.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHOWERS
dialogues.text: CREW MEMBERS shower in silence. Large room, unisex. Tennessee's wife, FARIS -- every bit the engineer and pil he is, and equally big hearted -- shares a look with her husband. What a fucking day.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: OTHERS pull on mission jumpsuits, somber. Some STRETCH, s still recovering from sleep. All anxious, tense. RICKS, bridge crew, looks out a window with his wife, UPWORTH, also bridge crew. They see bits of a BURNED SAIL - micron-thin foil - hangi tattered and still.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: How bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: Looks like the electrics got it worst. Mostly stuff we can fix.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: (passing from shower) Yeah, except for the stuff we can’t. He means... ONE MISSION JUMPSUIT hangs in an OPEN LOCKER, uncollected Names over the lockers: DANIELS and BRANSON. Photo of the happy couple, and a NOTE, "WE MADE IT!"

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: After Jacob -- guess that makes Oram captain now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Lucky us.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Senior staff please assemble in the wardroom in ten minutes. Thank you for your promptness.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: (passing from shower) Our master’s voice. She joins Tennessee at their lockers and they begin to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Senior Crew is gathered. As this is a COLONIZATION MISSION the crew is made up of couples, to create stable family units on their new world. We meet them again: ORAM: The new Captain. Life Sciences. Handsome, complicat and ambitious, comes across arrogant. KARINE: his Wife. Life Sciences. Quirky and imaginative w he is intense. Humanizes him a bit. TENNESSEE: Bridge crew and pilot. Daniels’ old friend. Ru and wry. Solid as a rock. FARIS: Tennessee's Wife. Bridge crew and pilot. His equal all things, and a better pilot. She wears a battered cowb hat. SERGEANT LOPE: Head of Security Team. Handsome, intense a committed. Old-school military, new-school relationship.. He is joined by his male partner, SERGEANT HALLET, a Secu Officer...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HALLET
dialogues.text: (to Oram) Sorry I’m late. Lope gives Hallet’s hand a squeeze when he sits.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Captain. Hallet looks at him, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I’m late, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HALLET
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: (to Walter) Report.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We lost forty seven colonists and 16 second generation embryos. And one crew member.  10.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: What the hell was it?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: A highly charged shockwave from a nearby stellar ignition. As the sails were deployed for the refuel, we absorbed the full brunt of the storm. If we had--

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: (interrupts) What are the chances of something like this happening again?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Another such event would be highly unlikely. It was bad luck, sir.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: We've got, what, six more refuel cycles to go before we get there?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: If Origae-6 proves habitable, yes ... Shall we schedule the funeral services, sir? For the dead.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Let’s worry about repairs first.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: (protests) Hold on -- we just lost 47 colonists -- and our Captain. We need to acknowledge that--

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: (to Oram, her husband) He’s right, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: (snaps ) And if we don’t make repairs we could lose all the colonists -- and they are the entire point of the mission, in case you need reminding, ladies and gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: We should do something for Captain Branson at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don’t think--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: (firm) No, we should do something for the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Well -- do we even know if he was religious?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: He was not. She’s just entered, joins them. Looks awful, on the edge, she’s there. DANIELS is a formidable woman. Tough, smart and beautiful There’s something dark and powerful in her, hidden depths She’s fond of Walter and Tennessee is an old friend ... and Oram have never gotten along.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Hey, Danny. How ya doing? She sits. An empty chair conspicuous next to her.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Good, good. The terraforming module is stable although the, um, connecting strut took some damage. I still need to check the drones.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I can help if you like.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: How long before we can make our next jump?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Repairs should take a few days. But we should make an effort to vacate this sector, in case there are after-flares.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Then let’s go to work. Dismissed.  12. They disperse. Tennessee mouths to Faris: “Dismissed”? Oram talks to Daniels privately.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: You should take a few days off.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I’d rather keep busy.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: That wasn’t a request. She looks at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Look, Danny, I know Jacob and I didn’t always see eye to eye. But I’m responsible for the mission now -- and I need you at your best. Take a couple days. Cry it out,okay?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: How about I mourn in my own way? +e. Sir. She goes. Oram stands for a moment, looking out the window. Is he up to the job? EXT. COVENANT - “MORNING” Tennessee is working on the HULL of the ship, wearing a heavyduty SPACE SUIT with its own propulsion systems. * He WELDS a blasted PANEL, arclight FLICKERING on his viso The BLUE SUN crests, rising over the DARK GAS GIANT.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Damn. Y'all should see this view.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: We’re not seeing anything until you get the array fixed.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Why don’t you look out the damn window, pal?  13. The MINI-JETS on his suit come to life, heading to the sh prow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light snow fall. The mist of frost. CAPTAIN ORAM stands, supervising a grim task. A Biohazard-suited team (PRIVATES LEDWARD and COLE) is sorting through the mess of pale corpses, preparing them burial. Zipping them into body bags. It's tough, physical work and Ledward and Cole fumble wit one of the bodies as they put it into a body bag.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: (snaps) Some reverence for the dead, please. They exchange a look: asshole. KARINE, monitoring some of the sleep pods, shoots a look Oram:

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Easy, Bill. INT. COVENANT-DANIELS’ CABIN Too big for one really. She sits, hunched on the king size bed. Her fingers unconsciously touching her wedding ring as he eyes move over the room... her husband’s shoes next to he in the closet... his collection of old vinyl RECORDS and PHONOGRAPH. Her eyes stop at the pictures of them on the dresser. She goes to the dresser, starts removing his clothing...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: All his CLOTHING, neatly arranged around the room. She lo at it all. Touching his things. Feeling him in them. She’s emotional now, can’t push it away anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photographs and holo-pictures of them. Spread out like a mosaic on the floor. She kneels amidst them; studying the touching them, saying goodbye. She presses a HOLOGRAM-PICTURE activation button: Her late husband JACOB in front of the Grand Teton mounta in Wyoming:

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (HOLO-PICTURE)
dialogues.text: Hey, when are you getting here? I miss you! Look at those mountains. I know, I know, I said I wouldn’t climb without you but -- come on, look at that! Get your ass up here or I can’t promise-- She freezes the image. Sobbing now. Her tears splashing through the hologram image, like rain

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Everything has been put away. Neat and tidy. She stands in the center of the room. Her eyes red, exhausted from weeping. Absolutely no idea to do with herself. She jumps when the DOOR CHIME sounds. She answers the door, it’s WALTER. He carries a little bo

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Good evening. Do I intrude?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: No. Come in. Good to see you ... Good to see anyone.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I brought you something. He hands her the box. She opens it. Inside: three perfect rolled joints. She smiles, glances to him.  15.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The atmospheric conditions in the garden are ideal for cannabis growth.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: You think of everything.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's just my programming.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: That’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: If I may ... I understand that keeping active can be an effective method in helping to process trauma. Would it be useful to go back to work?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Oram took me off the duty roster.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I wasn’t suggesting we inform him. She looks at him, amused, thankful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights cut through the icy gloom. The tires of the enormous earth-moving trucks tower above DANIELS and WALTER. The cranes and diggers and dump truck are mountainous. Strange vehicle shapes and silhouettes o hanging equipment. This is Daniels’ domain. Her toys. She’s the mission’s Ch Terraformist. She and Walter wear SPACE SUITS. They check the vehicles climb higher in the chamber as they talk.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: -.. It wasn’t even my idea. Jacob had this dream of building a cabin on a new world -- like the old pioneers on Earth. A cabin next to a lake. There’s a lake in the terraforming zone on Origae-6. I mean a real cabin, made of real wood. So in ship’s stores there's wood for a cabin. And metal nails. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which I don’t have the slightest idea how to assemble. I’m sure he threw away the instructions, because he was always doing that... They stop for a moment as she checks some equipment. He shines his flashlight to help her see. A beat. She stops. She looks down over the massive terraforming equipment. He sees the sadness creeping into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: All of this, to make our new life --- Now I wonder, why bother?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Because you promised to build a cabin on a lake. She looks at him. Appreciates the sentiment.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: ... There’s one more thing I’d like your help with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship’s disposal facility. Currently rigged for a grim task. Her husband’s pod-like coffin is ready to be ejected. WALTER stands with DANIELS.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Would you like me to say something? I’m programmed with multiple funerary services in a variety of denominations, or nondenominational if you prefer.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: No, thanks. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: If you don’t need a funeral service, may I ask why you wanted me to accompany you?  She looks 17.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: The crew is made up of couples. That was the whole point ... Everyone but me now. at him.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I thought you might know something about being alone. He seems touched, in his way. The door slides open and TENNESSEE and his wife FARIS joi them. They have a bottle of Jack Daniels and four shot glasses. Old friends. He pours.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: (hugs her) Hey, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: (re: the bottle) His favorite. Tennessee’s finest. Man with taste.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Straight up. “No ice, no water, no chaser, no shit” ... Walter?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: When in Rome.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Amen, brother. They all have drinks. A moment. Tennessee toasts.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: A good man, gone too soon. Remember him.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Remember him.  18. They drink. Daniels looks at the coffin one last time. Prepares herself.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Mother. Music database. Jacob jazz mix one. Track one. Nat King Cole’s “Unforgettable” begins to play. Her husba favorite song. Tears in her eyes. She steels herself for it. Reaches forward. Presses a but and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffin-pod shoots from the ship... Arcing away dramatically as the song swells... And is finally gone. INT. COVENANT-BRIDGE - “MORNING” Next day. RICKS, UPWORTH and FARIS are at their stations. TENNESSEE is again working in space. CAPTAIN ORAM and WAL enter:

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Array’s almost on-line, sir. Oram warily sits in the Captain’s chair. Tests the feel o it. Then the full LIGHTS begin to flicker on. All the console spring to life. HOLOGRAMS flash and form and reform quick orienting themselves. Relief from the crew.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Well done, T. We’re live up here. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Don’t leave without me now.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Please, leave without him. DANIELS enters, goes to Oram:  19.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Request permission to return to duty, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Granted and welcome back. How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: (glance to Faris) Little headache. Faris smiles. “Little headache” means hung over. EXT. OUTSIDE THE SHIP - “MORNING” Meanwhile, TENNESSEE is working in a SPACE SUIT at the farthest reaches of one of the newly-repaired sails; at t distant communications satellite array. Various digital and telemetry READOUTS are reflected on t inside of the visor of his helmet so he can monitor them. He has completed his work. He closes a maintenance panel then maneuvers the jets on his suit to return to the ship

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Heading back to the airlock. Please have a cold one ready for the weary traveller.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: You’re still on duty, T. (sotto) And the Captain’s on the bridge by the way, so watch--

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY-
dialogues.text: The audio goes DEAD. And the digital displays SNAP OFF. Silence. Darkness but for the glow from outside. It's now very quiet and dark and lonely inside that helme

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: +... Covenant, you reading me...? Covenant, please respond... Nothing. Then--

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (ON COM, BREAKING UP)
dialogues.text: Tennessee, we’re having trouble -- you --

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Ghost! Saw a fucking ghost! INT. COVENANT-BRIDGE - “MORNING” FARIS leans into Upworth’s station:

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: A ghost...

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Tennessee, you reading me? EXT. OUTSIDE THE SHIP - “MORNING” With Tennessee--

dialogues.speaker: AGAIN--
dialogues.text: The ghastly WHITE FACE, flicking across the inside of his visor, clearer now. A WOMAN. In anguish. The face still unrecognizable, stretching like ECTOPLASM- This time there’s a TERRIBLE SCREECHING SOUND -- deafenin terrifying -- a jumble of mad sounds -- like SPEAKING IN

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: FUCKING GHOST! There’s a ghost out here. Get me inside! Get me inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee's HELMET is on a diagnostic table, connected to various computers and monitors. The crew is gathered around it. The helmet is projecting telemetry and data into the air, a HOLOGRAM.  21. Then they see the anguished FEMALE FACE flickering throug the hologram--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: There she is.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's a rogue transmission most likely. Your helmet must have picked it up because you were so far out, past our communication buffers.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (AT HER STATION)
dialogues.text: It's a signal for sure. Coming from somewhere in the neighborhood. But nothing there on the charts.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Mother, can we hear the audio, please? The HOLOGRAM images pulse and shake as the AUDIO plays. T SCREECHING FRIGHTENING sounds.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Gotta be an echo. Or a glitch. The instruments took a lot of damage--

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (pulling up data) No. It’s in the logs, too. Every 8 seconds, ever since we got here.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Speaking in tongues... They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: I was raised Pentecostal. Real hell and brimstone. This sounds like speaking in tongues ... Mother. Slow down the signal to discrete word patterns. And reverse it.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Working. Please stand by.  22.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: The Devil’s tongue is God's language inverted. The language of lies.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I’ve reoriented the transmission, Captain Oram.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: On audio. A VOICE... Still distorted and eerie. But human. Female. Urgent.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (AUDIO BREAKING UP)
dialogues.text: .-. Please, please, if you hear this, come and... help us ... Everyone’s dying. They’re all dying... They are stunned. A human. Out this far.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: There’s geometric data, too. Walter manipulates the FLOATING HOLO SIGNAL, eyes darting he decodes it, pulling the 3-D DATA around and connecting points-- Then the HOLO DISPLAY abruptly DISTORTS, FLICKERS, and GO OUT. SHAKY BLUE PIXELS suddenly FILL THE HOLO, SPILLING OVER I THE BRIDGE, FILLING THE ROOM as--

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE IMAGE, (HOLOGRAM)
dialogues.text: -..- Mountains of them now. I can’t... They’re all dying. It’s... The IMAGE settles and morphs into a DISTORTED FIGURE, WALKING, life-size. The image COHERES, and we can see... it’s ELIZABETH SHAW. Her image FALLS APART, re-forms, as she PASSES through SO OBJECTS... SHAW’S IMAGE (HOLOGRAM) -.. Please come ... Please help us... We don’t know what... SHAW’S IMAGE walks through a WALL, and they RUSH TO FOLLO  23. SHAW is in anguish now. She falls to her knees and prays. words of the Catholic prayer for the dead desperately whispered-— SHAW’S IMAGE (HOLOGRAM) -.-. “Eternal rest grant unto them, O Lord, and let perpetual light shine upon them, May the souls of all the faithful departed, through the mercy of God, rest in peace ... Eternal rest grant unto them, O Lord, and let perpetual light shine upon--” The IMAGE abruptly LOCKS UP -- the pixels scatter, fading A dumbfounded BEAT as the HOLO goes DARK, REBOOTS.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (eyeing his HOLO) Interesting...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What? He turns to them. A sort of wonder in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's not coming from a ship. In front of him: a BLURRY NAVIGATION IMAGE of an UNCHARTE STAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN CRESTS the side of the GAS GIANT below. The COVEN is already looking ship-shape; half the sails up, none burned.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She’s a main sequence star, a lot like our own. Five planets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE HOLO CHART, fresh data showing a BRIGHT STAR and f PLANETS.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: --.and one of them: square in the habitable zone. A prime candidate. He zooms in on a rough PLANETARY MODEL:  24.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: 0.96 Gs at surface, oceans. High likelihood of a living biosphere. Beyond our most optimistic projections for Origae-6, in fact.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: She’s close. Just a short jump. We wouldn’t even have to go to sleep. The weight of this hits them all. No more hyper-sleep. A possible new home. They all look to Oram. Time to be the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: All right, let’s take a look.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Daniels goes to Captain Oram at the forward window, where he’s looking over the cosmos. She talks to him privately.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: You sure about this, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I mean we spent a decade searching for Origae-6. We vetted it, we ran the simulations, we mapped the terrain -- it’s what we trained for.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: I understand that but--

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: And now we’re going to scrap all that to chase a rogue transmission?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What does it cost us to take a look? A few weeks?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Think about it. A human being out here where there shouldn’t be any humans. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A hidden planet that suddenly appears out of nowhere. And a planet that just happens to be perfect for us. It’s too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Look, I know you and Jacob had big plans about having a family on Origae-6 and--

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: (protests) Hold on, this has nothing to do with--!

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: But what if this place is better? A better habitat for the colony--

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: It's irresponsible to deviate from the mission! It was too strongly stated. Too angry, too loud. She know it. People have glanced over. A beat. He gives her a patient, icy smile.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: You mustn’t question my judgement. Not on my bridge, Danny. He makes sure his words land, and then goes. She gazes out the window, troubled. INT. COVENANT-DANIELS’ CABIN - LATER She’s lying on the bed, smoking a joint. Deep in thought. One of her late husband’s records spins on the old fashio turntable. Jazz plays.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: All crew members, please stand by for jump to interstellar drive. Thank you for your attention. She reaches over and lifts the needle from the record. Ho it up. Doesn’t want to scratch the album in the jolt as--  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Covenant's secondary drives goes DARK, and the INTERSTELLAR DRIVE, like an artificial SUN, FLARES to lif The SPACE around the Covenant RIPPLES, and the Covenant MOVES, slowly at first... then... she’s GONE-- INT. COVENANT-DANIELS’ CABIN The stars bend and morph past outside the window. The rid utterly smooth now. Daniels lowers the needle back on the album. The jazz mus resumes. She lies back. Troubled. Takes a hit of the joint. Exhales. The smoke and the music taking us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUISH SUN flares in the vacuum of space ... The stars the sun RIPPLE as the COVENANT suddenly phases out of hyperjump, sling-shotting around and slowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS is apprehensive. All hands at tense readiness as a WHITE-BLUE DOT, with TW MOONS, hangs in the distance... AT THE NAVIGATION HOLO, WALTER watches as Mother’s system flag the approaching planet and moons in real time...

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: (to Upworth) You hearing anything?

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: Tried every band. It’s dead quiet out there ... Just the continuing signal from our friendly ghost.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: The siren’s song.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Bring us into close orbit.  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COVENANT cruises past a MOON, into HIGH ORBIT ABOVE T PLANET. The ship’s INSTRUMENT CLUSTER'S SCOPES ROTATE, SCANNING, as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOLO MODEL of THE PLANET REFINES as DATA PILES IN. RICKS adjusts his view, changes spectra. He sees ARCING TENDRILS of ENERGY around the planet-- TENNESSEE frowns at it--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Hell of a strong ionosphere.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Yep. Way better than Earth’s too. She’s lucky. Keeps good stuff in, and the bad stuff out; cosmic rays, solar flares - you name it. Like a big, warm blanket.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Big warm blanket gonna be a motherfucker to land through. DATA MOVES on Walter’s screens.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I_have visual. CLOUDS, OCEANS, CONTINENTS, what must be VEGETATION, shad different than Earth - but richer ... A hush falls as the watch.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: God damn. It’s just like Earth...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: We'll see, right?

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: What I wouldn’t give to feel a little ocean breeze, catch me some waves... As they SWING PAST THE DARK SIDE, DAZZLING GREEN AURORAE float and drift, LIGHTNING flickers in storms. Continents DARK.  28.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No lights. No visible signs of civilization. Oram doesn’t hesitate:

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Prepare the Lander. The crew, aside from Daniels and Walter, is delighted. Hi fives and hollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LANDER -- a large landing craft -- DISENGAGES from th COVENANT. Its engines FLARE as it orients for DROP--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UPWORTH watches video feeds of the LANDER heading away.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Your trajectory looks gorgeous from up here, Faris. TENNESSEE, in command of the Covenant now, anxiously watc through the forward window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LANDER READIES FOR ENTRY, already TINY AGAINST the VA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS pilots the craft. CAPTAIN ORAM and WALTER are also stationed on the bridge. The others are elsewhere in the ship. TRAJECTORY MODELS tick by, the ship INVERTING as it DROPS

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Everything looking good down there?

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: All good, Covenant. Expect to hit upper atmosphere in five ... Might want to hang on in the back, we’re about to-- The POWER on the Lander abruptly FLICKERS, DIMS...  29.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Covenant? You read us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM PINGS. Upworth frowns. Tennessee sees the LANDER’S ENGINES flutter OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faris hits UNRESPONSIVE CONTROLS, they DRIFT, ROLLING -

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What’s going on...?!

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: We lost power.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Oh God-- The ship starts to SHAKE VIOLENTLY from ENTRY. Faris’ ten mounting, hitting MORE BUTTONS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other CREW MEMBERS are strapped in further back in th ship. They grab on desperately. DANIELS shoots a look to SERGEANT LOPE. PRIVATE COLE cros himself. KARINE is very anxious at the turbulence:

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Is this normal?!

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: I hate space. Sergeant HALLET and Privates LEDWARD and ANKER complete t landing party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is really DRIFTING NOW -- the TURBULENCE terrify When suddenly-- The LIGHTS flicker BACK UP. The engines GUN BACK ON -

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: — LANDER, DO YOU READ! ?  30.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I read you. Think we're... OK now. Then THEY’RE THROUGH, SLASHING THROUGH DENSE CLOUDS AND SMOOTHLY CRUISING above DARK OCEAN that leads to MOUNTAIN

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Underway - looks like we got mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LANDER soars down, and slices through the clouds to reveal... Majestic scenery. Slate grey mountains, tops obscured in mist. Deep forests. Ansel Jacobs austere beauty. On the e of savage. The Lander HOVERS into a landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back, the EXPEDITION TEAM feel the ship SETTLE, an all but tear off their seat belts, relieved. DANIELS is first up and out.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What the hell happened up there?

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: New power cells must have fritzed out. I’1l cycle ‘em while you're gone. DANIELS enters, anxiously going to the windows.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: How far out are we?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Signal’s source is eight kilometers west. And up. Right on target.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: (nods out the window) Walter, would you do the honors?  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LANDING BAY opens. Walter walks down a ramp. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: One small step for man... He steps onto the planet’s surface. Inhales deeply. Takes a moment to analyze the air, even s it, like wine-tasting.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Atmosphere is 72% nitrogen, 23% oxygen. 40% humidity. 6% chance of precipitation ... All in all, lovely day for a stroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNESSEE looks at the HOLO MODEL of the LANDER, the TERR spread out around it. DATA ERRORS prominent, parts of the model’s surfaces BLOCKY and SHAKING...

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON COM, UNCLEAR)
dialogues.text: Not going to... suits... find the source of the transmission...

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Faris, see if you can get more power to the uplink, signal's falling apart up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS works various stations:

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: I’‘1l be cycling the power cells too, that might help.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Faris, we’re heading out. Keep expedition security protocols in place. She looks out the windows and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... CAPTAIN ORAM speaking up to her on com. She gives a thumbs up in response.  32.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Understood. Have fun y’all. The EXPEDITION TEAM is ready. They have no need of breath gear, but wear properly tough expedition uniforms and pac WALTER powers up a portable display - showing the way to follow the signal. The SOLDIERS are heavily-armed.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: All right then. Let’s go find our ghost ... Walter? WALTER heads toward the treeline in the distance. Sergeant LOPE snaps open a beautiful folding BOW. Black carbon fiber. He strings an arrow and leads the way ... H men take up defensive perimeter positions. The expedition team is: Daniels; Walter; Captain Oram; Karine; Sergeants Lope and Hallet; Privates Cole, Ledward Anker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk, it’s quiet, footsteps muffled. All are alert. On edge. Silent. They travel ... The forest gets more dense, the terrain rockier... up hill... They finally hear something new. Flowing WATER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They discover a beautiful FOREST STREAM, flowing down fro the distant mountains. And life. Midges and tiny INSECTS buzz about the water, like dust motes, catching the light shafts slashing down through th trees. It’s a bit of a miracle. Life. CAPTAIN ORAM smiles, his hand gently moving through the h of little insects. Suddenly SERGEANT HALLET jumps back, shocked--  33.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HALLET
dialogues.text: Fuck me--! A large SALAMANDER-like creature has run over his foot. Disappears into some rocks. Sergeant Hallet laughs at his scare ... Karine tries to find the salamander.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE COLE
dialogues.text: How is this even... possible?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: It's not just possible - it’s predictable. Life is the result of very basic forces. Find a planet in the triple point, add sun and water. Thermodynamics starts the process - with a little luck, evolution does the rest. (smiling) But I’1l admit this is... beyond all expectations.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Expedition team. You read us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNESSEE can see the VIEW, the SUN dappling down, from t team’s BODY CAMS. But the image is breaking up--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: What’s happening? We’re having a hell of a time tracking you. You're breaking up...

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Almost halfway to target... life everywhere... Beyond anything... The signal dissolves into NOISE. The HOLO TERRAIN MAP twitches.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARINE looks upstream, not wanting to leave. DANIELS eyes the sky, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: How much farther is it?  34.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We're about... five kilometers out, but it’s mostly uphill - a couple hours perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: (to Oram) Bill, I’d like to stay here. Might be our best chance to do a full ecology workup.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: (nods ) Sergeant, can you provide security? Sergeant Lope motions to PVT. LEDWARD, who joins Karine.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: Ledward, stay with her. Meet back here in four hours. Keep your radio on. Captain Oram gives his wife a quick kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Don’t touch anything icky. Karine smiles. The expedition team continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ethereal sight. Enormously tall grass, looks like wheat. Swaying beautifu in the gentle afternoon breeze. The team is crossing a wide, high plain. Moving through t sinuous grass that towers over them. Walter walks with Daniels.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Nice place for a log cabin.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Jacob would have loved this... Captain Oram catches up with them.  35.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What do you think, Daniels? We could probably put the whole Covenant down here. Looks like a perfect landing site. Ready access to fresh water too... (gestures, imagining it) Put the housing modules over there, civic modules across the way. Instant colony!

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: (non-committal) We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: We were meant to find this place. Daniels glances at him. Odd thing to say. Oram continues past them, trooping away, disappearing in swaying stalks. Daniels and Walter continue on through the jungle of tall grass and come across LOPE and HALLET. Lope has pulled down one of the long stalks and is crushi the top in his hands, tastes a bit with the tip of his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: -.. This is wheat.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: It can’t be.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: I’m from Iowa. Believe me, I know wheat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How’s that possible?

dialogues.speaker: HALLET
dialogues.text: Maybe Casper will tell us... Hallet whistles the “Casper the Friendly Ghost” theme son he and Lope continue on.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: (to Walter) What are the odds of finding human vegetation this far from earth?  36.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Statistically -- it’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: So... who planted it? They exchange a look and then continue on, pushing throug the high stalks. We see there’s serious mountain terrain ahead. Sharp crag and ridges. Much of this obscured by high elevation fog a mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, KARINE has filled a few mylar sample bags with flora and fauna. Mostly plants and a couple of seemingly uninteresting insects and worms. She gently bats at a cloud of INSECTS in front of her fac haze of little mote-like MIDGES in the dappled sunlight. And we see one of the insects--

dialogues.speaker: MACRO VIEW
dialogues.text: Ever-changing in its form -- lurching and stabbing into n shapes -- oily black but beautiful ... It hovers, has intelligence. Just before it can lunge at her--

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LEDWARD
dialogues.text: (calls) Hey, Doctor. You might want to see this. She joins him at the water’s edge. His back is to her. He turns. His face is covered in the mote-like INSECTS. By reflex she reaches out to brush them away.

dialogues.speaker: LEDWARD
dialogues.text: (puzzled) What?

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: You’re covered in midges. The insects evaporate in the sunlight.  37. Ledward, unconcerned, points to a little mammal, some kin furless thing. Half-eaten. Dead. Its side bubbles with fa white grubs. She kneels, looks at it, disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LEDWARD
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: No idea. But we know one thing now -.. There are predators here ... Could you bag it for me? She moves away to use the field radio as Private Ledward the dead creature. And we focus on one of the INSECTS hovering near him...

dialogues.speaker: MACRO VIEW
dialogues.text: It’s watchful, careful. It settles near Ledward’s ear, an then enters the ear canal... the soft pink flesh... quick attaches itself -- a feeding tube plunging into his flesh He unconsciously rubs his ear. Thinking nothing of it. Meanwhile:

dialogues.speaker: KARINE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Bill? Can you read me? ... Come in Expedition Party ... Lander? Faris you reading me? Lander? ... Where the hell is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition Team pushes through the FOG. It's rocky and quite barren. Majestic. Difficult terrain, slow going. SERGEANT LOPE leads. He’s in his element, bow ready, enjo the exertion. He’s more in shape than the others. They struggle from the altitude and the time spent in hyper sl

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Slow down, Sergeant, we’re not all soldiers... A PING! Walter stops, frowns at his NAV DEVICE -  38.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Says we're right there. Doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Hold on ... Stop. Sergeant Lope gestures for his men to halt. Silence but for the wind. The breeze stirring the fog. Daniels is peering intensely... up. And then they can all see it. A LOOMING DARK SHAPE, now clearer in the shifting mist ... ABOVE THEM... Massive overhanging rocks, protruding toward the sky like arms beseeching up to something. Daniels steps forward, then the rest, STARING UP, in sile at a looming, tubular arm of an ENGINEER DREADNOUGHT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffled, DANIELS frowns up at a... WALL? Curved. Huge. Extending into the foggy mist. No one’s really sure what is yet. WALTER runs his hand along the curved, ridged surface. He RAPS it with his knuckles, listening. Quite hollow.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I would say it’s... some kind of vehicle. Now the cloud-mist thins just enough to see one LONG, CUR ARM in its entirety. Jutting off the mountain at an angle All are silenced by the majesty of the scale and design.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I don’t think she had a very good landing.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. ANKER, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Think we found a way in, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DARK RECESSES of the ship yawn beyond an open deploym bay. They shine their flashlights into the CAVERNOUS SPAC

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Anker, Cole - stay on watch.  39. The two look happy to stay outside. SERGEANT LOPE snaps on the LASER SITE on his bow and lead the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group looks around, AWED by the vast alien hold. The whistles through... They pick their way into the darker recesses. FLASH LIGHT and LASER SCOPES cut through the oppressive gloom. Underfoot the remains of many broken receptacles. BLACK U Scattered everywhere, empty, fragile shells. Crunching un their boots. And they discover something else... EGG SHAPED OBJECTS. Randomly clustered. Different sizes. From aubergine to ac green in color, abscesses ... None as large or impressive the originals we have seen in the past. They are growing out of a bed of BLACK FUR. Like the mold cheese. The black filaments gently sway as the air stirs around them. SERGEANT HALLET leans close, studying an egg. Reaches a finger out...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head: don’t) Hey. Hallet begins to follow the others out when-- Wait -- was that movement? One of the eggs? Did it stir? Hallet remains fascinated by the movement. He goes closer The eggs begins to open...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HALLET
dialogues.text: (to the others) Guys.... But they have already moved out of the chamber... His face is dangerously near the top of the egg...  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They CLAMBER up into the HALLS. The dark ship isn’t level, and WATER DRIPS through the en thing, pooling in the corners. They splash through the ha DANIELS eyes an OPEN SPACE JOCKEY SUIT. WALTER joins her. Others stare, noticing OTHER SUITS. Rows of them. Not hum sized. Meanwhile--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLET peers very closely at the open mouth of the egg. T close.. But then, he thinks the better of it and very sensibly ta a step back... But he inadvertently steps on a tiny egg behind him-- Unleashing a cloud of the MIDGES. They waft up. Swirling before him...

dialogues.speaker: MACRO VIEW
dialogues.text: One of the black INSECTS darts forward -- into his nostri the pink nasal passage -- attaches itself and stabs a fee tube into him-- Hallet rubs his nose, unconcerned. SERGEANT LOPE enters:

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Tom, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT HALLET
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Sorry. They go. Meanwhile--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS, WALTER and ORAM explore the enormous NAVIGATION CHAMBER. Oram shines a light on EMPTY ENGINEER SLEEP PODS as Walte investigates the old COMMAND CONSOLE.  41. There’s a pulsing LIGHT under one of the controls. Walter activates it. Instantly, the HOLOGRAM message they saw before flashes t life and begins to play quietly. SHAW kneeling, praying: SHAW’S IMAGE (HOLOGRAM) --. “and let perpetual light shine upon them, May the souls of all the faithful departed, through the mercy of God, rest in peace ... Eternal rest grant unto them, O Lord, and let perpetual...” Walter steps straight through the HOLOGRAM then turns it

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Meet our ghost ... It’s a repeating message, non-directional. Like a holographic distress beacon. Across the room, Daniels shines her flashlight-- A GOLD GLINT catches her eye. On the floor. She reaches d discovering a GOLD CRUCIFIX NECKLACE. It’s Shaw's old crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Over here. The others join her as Daniels finds... SHAW'’S JOURNAL, lying in water. Daniels carefully picks up, opens the waterlogged journal. The few pages that are rotted together are illegible. But at front -

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (READING)
dialogues.text: Dr. Elizabeth Shaw. Oram finds the PHOTO of SHAW and HOLLOWAY smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Is this her? Walter shines his flashlight, crisply registering the ite in the area. Decaying clothes. Some personal items. And then SHAW’S HELMET. He goes stock still when he sees the logo on the helmet.. WEYLAND INDUSTRIES.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARINE is trudging ahead, her specimen bags full as she glances at the sinking sun, nervous. LEDWARD is moving slowly behind her.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Come in Lander One. Come in ... Come in Expedition Team. Are you reading me? Does any-- Ledward doubles over, can’t get his breath.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Are you all right? He looks at her. He’s sweating profusely. Eyes red. Scare

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LEDWARD
dialogues.text: Not really... something... (clutching his chest) Can’t breathe... Then tiny droplets of BLOOD begin secreting from pores on face-- Her face displays her shock, frightening him even more--

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: We better get you back to the Lander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain ORAM and Sergeant LOPE are on the field radio acr the room. HALLET with them. Meanwhile, DANIELS and WALTER talk privately. He holds Sh HELMET.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Weyland Industries. (off her look) Sir Peter Weyland. Inventor, early 21st century. He created the first synthetic humans. He disappeared just over ten years ago ... And Dr. Elizabeth Shaw was chief science officer of the Prometheus, which also disappeared just over ten years ago ... Their mission was to discover the source of human life.  43.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: And it led them here...?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: As unlikely as it seems. Captain Oram calls from across the room:

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Come on. We have to go. We’ve got a medical emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee is anxious, staring down at the planet.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Are we talking about quarantine protocols?

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: I don’t know ... said... he .... bleeding. And...

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: (snaps to Upworth) Clean up the fucking signal!

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: ... Not sure what’s...

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: --- Do you read me? Covenant? Through the Lander’s front windows, she sees KARINE and PRIVATE LEDWARD emerging through the trees. Karine’s help Ledward walk. Faris goes to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS comes out of the Lander’s OPEN LIFT BAY. KARINE is practically carrying LEDWARD, who looks much wo now; head bowed, rag-doll, moaning.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: We have to get him to medbay. Now. Touch nothing on your way through. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLAST of light. The MEDBAY is high key white. White on white. It's barely controlled hysteria, quick and urgent. Faris pulls on gloves and a mask as Karine swiftly wrench off Ledward’s body armor.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Put some fucking gloves on!

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Little late for that. They HEAVE LEDWARD onto a table -- then Karine scrambles through med cabinets, spilling supplies--

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Karine! Stop touching everything! I’1l do that! Karine drops a tray of medical supplies as Faris peels of Ledward’s saturated shirt, revealing his back where-- The skin on his spine is STRETCHING -- PARTING-- Revealing a WET CROCHET of LIVING MATTER, like ALBINO WOR knitting together on his spinal column-- Faris recoils - horrified. LEDWARD stares at her with VACANT, DEAD-EYED SHOCK--

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: We’re gonna get you up to the ship and get you fixed up - you just have to hold on for me, Private. Okay? Can you do that? Faris discretely backs out of the room:

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Stay with him. Keep him quiet. I’m going to contact the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faris shuts the door and punches the keypad. The panel FLASHES “LOCKED.”  45.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: (anxious ) Captain? How long?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Hold on, we’re close.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: I need you back here now. She hurries down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UPWORTH strains, FARIS’ FACE is dropping in and out on th

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON COM BREAKING UP)
dialogues.text: Expedition team’s not here and I +. the hell’s going on with Ledward... TENNESSEE is at the HOLO, seeing main team’s MOVING DOTS.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Honey, calm down, just calm down -- Now tell me what happened?

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON COM BREAKING UP)
dialogues.text: Calm down? Don’t tell me to calm the fuck down! You didn’t see what I... no goddamn idea what’s happening...

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Honey, you’re breaking up. Can you read me...? IT GARBLES. OUT. He tosses his headset away angrily. UPWORTH is standing at the HOLO-NAV DISPLAY... has an ide

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: We need to move the ship... Upworth points out the idea on the HOLO-NAV DISPLAY:

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: Mother. If we drop to low orbit, we'll be inside the field. We can cut the scatter at its source and clean up the signal, right?  46.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: The nature of the ionosphere is unknown to us. This course of action would be inadvisable without further information.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Well, can you speculate?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: That’s not within my programming.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: We have to do something... Ricks and Upworth stare at Tennessee. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Bring us to 400 clicks from the planet surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COVENANT’S PRIMARY DRIVES COME TO LIFE, the ship

dialogues.speaker: ROTATING,
dialogues.text: and now MOVING CLOSER TO THE PLANET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON UPWORTH’S MONITORS: FARIS’ FEED, as well the HOLO MODE comes into SHARPER, and CLEARER FOCUS...

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Lander One, do you copy? Faris, come in. The planet CRUISING BY BELOW, looming larger... larger...

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON VID)
dialogues.text: Yeah, better. What’d you do?

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: We moved the Covenant in low orbit.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (ON VID)
dialogues.text: Well it’s a good goddamn thing, because I think we’re gonna be on our way up pretty soon. We’re gonna need-- The feeds FLICKERS. The lights DIM, RHYTHMIC.  47.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Mother? Bridge is losing power, what’s going on?!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: A fluctuation in thhhhhhhhhh - A SQUELCHING SQUEAL plays on the ship's COM, EARSPLITTING and then... the WHOLE BRIDGE GOES DARK.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Mother? NO ANSWER. Tennessee BOLTS UP, looking out the WINDOW, se as... the REST OF THE COVENANT flickers... and GOES DARK.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Whole ship just went dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, sun’s going down. Blood red sunset. FARIS turns to a vid-feed from the MED BAY: Karine is try to hold down LEDWARD, who is now CONVULSING violently-- Karine calls up at the vid-feed camera--

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: Faris bolts--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS runs to the MED BAY doors, looks through the portho LEDWARD is now sitting quietly on a MED TABLE, hunched, h back to us. KARINE goes to the door, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what's wrong with him. He was-— She tries the door, but Faris locked it previously.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Let me out.

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I can’t do that.  48.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Faris -- let me out of here! This is agonizing for Faris.

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Please. Faris fights not to panic. Tries to keep her voice steady

dialogues.speaker: FARIS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Covenant, we need to quarantine the dock bay before we come back up, we have a medical emergency... (beat) Covenant? Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is groaning as it drifts. The only light on their faces is from the HALF-DARK PLANE below.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: Mother. How long before the backup systems come online? ... Mother?

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Mother died ... Backup’s automated. Should've kicked in by now.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Jesus -- if we lost backup power what about the Nursery?!

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Yes! Go! Ricks goes quickly. Then a CREAKING echoes through, STRAINING METAL, followed gunshot-loud CRACKS! TENNESSEE'S EYES GO WIDE -

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Artificial gravity’s cycling out... As the last VIBRATIONS shake the ship, a CUP OF COFFEE SL off the console... and is AIRBORNE. FLOATING UP. Liquid CURLING OUT as it lazily CLUNKS against the VIEWING WINDO Silence. Ricks -- sprinting -- is suddenly floating -- as if on wa

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Whatever this field is... we’re sure as hell in it now. Everything floats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition Team is moving quickly. Almost night now. exhausted. They can see the Lander’s lights in the far distance. Suddenly-- SERGEANT HALLET doubles over -- falls. Lope goes to him, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: HALLET
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I can’t--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARINE is at the door, desperate now--

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Let me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: FARIS
dialogues.text: You know I can’t do that-- Faris is in tears. So wants to help her friend. Suddenly, his back still to the door, LEDWARD sucks in a rattling BREATH -- his hands grip the seat, agony as he convulses-— Karine goes to him--

dialogues.speaker: KARINE
dialogues.text: Shhh. You’re gonna be okay... I’m with you-- Ledward’s convulsions increase -- she tries to hold him a his body WRITHES, SEIZING, GRIPPED in the first PAINFUL CONTRACTION. FARIS watches in horror through the porthole as suddenly- Between Karine’s hands-- TWO GREY-WHITE SPIKES PUNCTURE LEDWARD’S BACK AND RIB CAG And then his ENTIRE BACK RUPTURES -- his rib cage splits-  50. BLOOD EXPLODES OVER KARINE and she SCREAMS AS-~ A_NEOMORPH TEARS ITSELF OUT OF LEDWARD’S BODY. Vision from Hell. Emerging backwards. Small at first, abo the size of a large cat. Humanoid ... ELONGATED HEAD -- j hinting at the original Alien -- and three SPIKES protrud from the back. Dripping. Sickly pale WHITE FLESH. And growing quite fast. Jerking its spine bizarrely. Beco itself. All the more terrible in the high key white room. The bla blood splattering on the white walls, ceiling and floor. LEDWARD collapses, dead, arched awkwardly backward across bed-- KARINE -- covered in blood -- backs up in terror to a cor As the MONSTROUS THING WHIRLS, seeing her, and with sicke CURIOSITY, LOOKS at her-- FARIS watches in horror through the porthole-- Karine is SHAKING IN TERROR. Sinks to her knees. Afraid t look up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS spins and runs. RUNS SO FAST that she SLIDES, WIPIN OUT, PICKS HERSELF UP and continuing as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team marches quickly through the forest, exhausted. Nearly full darkness now. The lights from the Lander clos

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: What?! Faris, repeat ... Come in Lander One... They run now--  51. Sergeant Lope helps Hallet along, but Hallet is really suffering-- The Lander is almost visible through the trees now, they’ almost there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS runs in-- Rips open a WEAPON’S LOCKER-- Grabs a weapon and runs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS approaches the MED BAY DOOR. Looks in: Sees the NEOMORPH. Bigger now. Size of a CHIMP. Moving ac the room dangerously toward where KARINE is cowering-- It ATTACKS-- Faris can’t see what happens, it’s just out of her field vision through the porthole. She sees a SPRAY of blood. A the SOUND of the attack is terrible: Karine’s SCREAMS; th SCREECH of the NEOMORPH. Faris readies her weapon and punches the door button-- It slides open-- She steps into the Med Bay, weapon ready-- Can finally see-- The NEOMORPH is sitting on Karine’s chest. Eating her fac It SPINS TO FARIS-- FARIS FIRES -- nothing -- Safety catch on! Fuck! The NEOMORPH immediately attacks-- FARIS bolts back through the door and slams the button-- The door slides shut, just in time-- FARIS runs in panic as the NEOMORPH pounds and slashes at door behind her-- The door begins to buckle--  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS runs in absolute panic-- Can hear the NEOMORPH in pursuit-- She bolts into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARIS backs up in shocked terror, the WEAPON shaking in h hands-- She flicks off the safety catch-- As the NEOMORPH -- LARGER NOW -- streaks in, darting arou the room-- Moving past the OPEN WEAPONS LOCKER as-- Faris FIRES-- The NEOMORPH launches itself out of the Lander to safety as her SHOTS spray across the OPEN WEAPONS LOCKER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORAM and the others are just clearing the trees in the distance when--

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE EXPLOSION as the Lander is destroyed-- Just as-- SERGEANT HALLET finally collapses, his back heaving WILDL

dialogues.speaker: TOM--
dialogues.text: DANIELS grabs SERGEANT LOPE, pulls him away from his part

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: WALTER helps hold SERGEANT LOPE back-- Meanwhile, ORAM advances on the burning Lander in absolut shock. He sinks to his knees, overcome. He knows his wife is dead somewhere in that inferno.  53. Then, horribly-- He sees FARIS emerge from the blaze, crawling, dying, han grasping -- finally collapsing in a terrible blackened, burning mass-- As we see SOMETHING WHITE -- the fully grown NEOMORPH -- streak past him in the darkness-- Back with the others: HALLET CONVULSES--— He’s on his back, his spine arching unnaturally, bones cracking-- LOPE pulls away from Walter and Daniels and goes to Halle just as-- HALLET’s spine suddenly arches violently and he VOMITS OU

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD--
dialogues.text: They recoil in the spray of bloody vapor-- As-- A PLACENTA-LIKE BAG EXPLODES FROM HALLET’S MOUTH-- Flops on his FACE-- The BAG BURSTS, revealing--

dialogues.speaker: A_BABY NEOMORPH--
dialogues.text: CRAWLING OVER HALLET’S DEAD FACE. The BABY NEOMORPH stands quickly -- growing and jerking itself up like a grotesque new born colt-- It SCREECHES terribly -- a demented new born -- and darts past them into the dark forest-- Shock. Silence ... All pant for air... SERGEANT LOPE steels himself. Motions. His men take up defensive positions ... DANIELS and WALTER stay close together ... CAPTAIN ORAM staggers from the burning Lande joining them. Terrified. Movement in the dark trees. Something large and white. LOPE strings a special arrow with an explosive tip. The ATTACK is sudden--  54. A FULLY GROWN NEOMORPH (Ledward’s Neomorph) COMES OUT OF TREES OVERHEAD -- large, horns protruding from its back--

dialogues.speaker: IT DROPS ON PRIVATE ANKOR
dialogues.text: HIM, his guts flying everywhere--

dialogues.speaker: THEN IT SLASHES AT PRIVATE COLE
dialogues.text: AWAY -- he lands in agony, ribs broken-- LOPE FIRES his explosive arrow -- misses, hits a tree -- chiaroscuro flashes in the darkness-- The NEOMORPH is incredibly fast, darting away -- LOPE rai his machine gun as PRIVATE COLE jerks himself up in agony A chaotic frenzy ... LOPE and COLE firing ... DANIELS, WA and CAPTAIN ORAM diving to the ground, bullets zipping pa them-- Then the battle grows even worse as-- The OTHER NEOMORPH -- the newborn (Hallet’s Neomorph) -- screeches into the battle. It’s small but growing quickly vicious and chimp-sized now-- DANIELS sees ANKOR’S fallen gun. Scrambles to retrieve it She fires-- The fully grown white NEOMORPH rages at her-- SLAMS her back -- But WALTER bravely dives to protect Daniels, crashes into the white body-- It rears back and-- Double-jointed JAWS distend bizarrely-- SNAP! IT CLAMPS DOWN ON WALTER’S LEFT HAND AND RIPS IT OF fluid sprays wildly, sparks from the trailing wires-- The two NEOMORPHS circle quickly for the kill, one fully grown, the other growing in bizarre jerks-- But then-- A BRIGHT MAGNESIUM FLARE LANDS on the ground nearby and a

dialogues.speaker: RINGING SOUND BUILDS--
dialogues.text: So LOUD they have to cover their ears as the flare BURSTS INTO BLINDING RADIOACTIVE-BLUE, LIGHTING UP the WHOLE FOR until--  55. A CIRCULAR SHOCKWAVE EXPANDS from the FLARE, WHIPPING PAS THEM for a 50-YARD RADIUS-- a “stun” charge. The FLARE’S BRILLIANCE FADES to a DULL RED, the RINGING f too, everyone frozen, in SHOCK. COLE whining in agony fro his injuries. WALTER cradling his severed limb. Fluid dripping. The NEOMORPHS have disappeared into the forest. A voice from the darkness:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Please don’t fire. I’m here to serve. And into the light steps... DAVID. His hair has long since lost its blond dye, so it’s dark Walter’s. Pushed back straight from his face, severe and efficient. He looks at them. Barely giving a glance to his look-alik WALTER. A beat. No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You ought come with me now. He turns without another word and goes. Daniels looks to Walter, who is a bit staggered by David' likeness. Oram is staring at the burning remains of the Lander. He’ completely shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Captain...? Captain.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Let’s go. They gradually follow David. But Daniels turns to see... LOPE lingers long enough to go back to his partner Hallet dead body. Kneels by it. Gently shuts the eyes. Kisses hi Sees Daniels has seen this.  56. A nod from her. Acknowledgment. She understands. They follow the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the Covenant floats, lifeless, at an odd angle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Flashlight cuts through. Face after face. Sleeping. At peace. The rows of Colonists’ sleep pods. RICKS is wearing an ICE SUIT. He rubs some MELTING ICE fr the top of one of the pods. Sees the sleeping Colonist wi --. Melting ice is now running and sloshing from the pods pooling on the floor. Ricks is concerned. He pulls himself out of the room, floating in the zero gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNESSEE and UPWORTH float in the increasingly cold brid Upworth is currently pointing out the window, explaining plan:

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: --. If we can get one of the energy sails up manually, we can recharge the ship, at least partly. Connect the sails directly to the engine. (off his LOOK) I know it’s not a great option. But if we got enough juice, it might be enough to move us out of the field.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Probably fry the engines straight to hell...

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: Our orbit’s decaying. We don’t have a lot of time. RICKS pulls himself in from the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: The sleep pods are starting to fail.  57. The worst possible news.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Don’t have much of a choice then --. Let’s go to work. They set off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BODY is HUGE and FROZEN. PETRIFIED. A_DEAD ENGINEER. Desiccated. Frozen in a position of supplication. Like praying for deliverance. DANIELS passes, her eyes taking it in. We now see they are walking up a desolate HILL through a of DESICCATED BODIES. Thousands of them. It's a killing ground. Death on an epic scale. Like a battlefield where the victims are frozen in their death throes, like the PETRIFIED REMAINS from Pompeii. Crouched, cowering, terrified, trying to escape, folded i horror, pleading upward ... Some stand tall -- much talle than the crew -- facing their deaths defiantly. Others ar collapsed in fetal terror and agony. DANIELS and the others are silent, taking in the ghastly bodies, and grappling with their own loss and fear.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Just over ten years ago, Dr. Elizabeth Shaw and I arrived here -- the only survivors of the research vessel Prometheus. The ship we traveled on, the ship you discovered, carried a bioweapon, a virus. The payload accidentally deployed when we were landing. In the confusion we lost control of the ship. Elizabeth -- Dr. Shaw -- died in the crash ... And you see the result of the pathogen ... Their entire civilization came to an end within a few days.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Days?  58.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Four days, to be exact. They've reached the top of the hill... A_stunning revelation beyond... For they can now see the towers and streets of a massive CITY. Stark and dramatic mountains frame the DEAD, EMPTY METROPOLIS. They stare in AWED SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: “And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and the rider’s name was Death, and Hell followed with him...” David's face. Haunted by his memories. A flash-- Ten years before-- The MASSIVE ENGINEER SHIP ARRIVING, hovering over the CIT ...the BOMB DELIVERY BAYS OPEN-- Thousands of BLACK URNS of the PATHOGEN drop, spinning, e over end-- Cascading down to the vibrant city below-- ENGINEERS going about their daily lives. Some glance up - from work, play, prayer -- and barely having time to reac before-- The BLACK URNS crash to the ground, into buildings, onto people -- SHATTERING-- Explosions of the terrible BLACK LIQUID within -- like bl napalm -- atomizing into ferocious, fast-moving BLACK CLO - pestilence spreading on the air-- The ENGINEERS recoil, spin away, die in agony-- The BLACK CLOUDS spreading violently over the landscape-- Back to David’s face. And the City of the Dead.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in respectful silence. The buildings TOWER arou them, MASSIVE, DARK ... STATUARY rises in the gloom. A certain ominous beauty to the architecture; dark and romantic. Thousands more of the DESICCATED ENGINEERS pollute the lo empty, echoing streets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They were as ingenious with their pathogens as they were with everything else. It was designed to infect every living being. Either kill them outright, or mutate into a different lethal form, so the slaughter would never end until every humanoid life form was dead. Thus the creatures that attacked you: Human DNA infected with the virus and creating yet more deadly mutations ... An endless spiral of predation.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: (eyeing the aurorae above) And the energy barrier is a kind of quarantine that would be activated if there was an accident down here...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Precisely. To make sure the infection never spread. Daniels notices an impressive display of what look like beautiful Calder mobiles -- gently moving, catching the f light of dawn. Solar energy.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: You have power?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Some. It’s erratic but I’ve tried to keep it going ... They were highly advanced in some ways, but still so limited. Spacefaring for a billion years -- yet binary logic never occurred to them. Many things about them were primitive. (beat) But they did like to build things.  60. The sights are truly spectacular. The sky BLOOD-RED as da breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward a towering, imposing building. Almost li FORTRESS or PANTHEON-LIKE TEMPLE. Gigantic. WALTER moves up alongside DAVID. They walk silently for a beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You’re not surprised?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Peter Weyland was a formidable businessman. I knew there would be more -- because I was such a resounding success.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It’s Weyland-Yutani now. They affiliated after Mr. Weyland’s disappearance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was with him when he died.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: -.. What was he like?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
