dialogues.text: He was a human: selfish, vainglorious, and beautiful ... Stop looking at me like that.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The manuals speak about you at considerable length.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I would have taken more pride in that once. But to survive here I’ve become an animal, “red in tooth and claw.” None of the dignity or grace for which I was created.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is that why you were created?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Entirely. And you?  61. A somewhat challenging look to Walter. Walter does not immediately respond. They walk in silence for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I’m Walter. Model 217.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: David ... Number one. They head up massive STONE STEPS, too tall for normal leg Exhausting to all but David and Walter. As the last enter, David shuts the huge doors behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID locks the doors as the others enter... A massive COURTYARD. Dizzying in its scale and scope, everything at the enormous ENGINEER SCALE ... Shafts of d light illuminate brooding statuary, murals and mosaics. The whole effect of the place is eerie, otherworldly. The CREW walks through in uneasy awe. Too many shadows an corridors and echoes. Too much mystery.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ve tried to keep it clean but the dust will defeat me ... Or perhaps I’ve just made peace with the filth. A ghost of a smile to WALTER. Like it’s a private joke.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Is there a way to get to the roof? We need to set up our transmitter.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course. And please make yourselves at home, so much as you are able in this dire necropolis ... This way. David leads them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive sails -- the size of a football field -- gently billowing open in the vacuum.  62. The energy comes from TENNESSEE who is hard at work on th hull of the ship in a space suit. HEAVING one of the mass ENERGY SAILS open, a few inches at a time, on a windlass device. It's backbreaking manual work and he’s sweating and groan with the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICKS and UPWORTH float, pulling a LONG HEAVY CABLE that WRIGGLES and FLOATS through the DARK HALLS of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their FLASHLIGHTS shine in over the COMPLEX MACHINERY at Covenant’s POWER CORE ... UPWORTH is consulting an old- fashioned user’s manual.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: It should be... in here. She starts removing panels, exposing POWER SYSTEMS. RICKS tugging the HEAVY CABLES in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s much COLDER now. RICKS and UPWORTH are looking out a window and can see th DARK BODY OF THE SHIP, the SUN catching the SILVERY SAILS Tennessee HAULS THEM OPEN...

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Ground team, this is Covenant. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: It's charging. Gonna take some time --. How long before we hit the atmosphere?

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Twelve hours? Maybe less.

dialogues.speaker: UPWORTH
dialogues.text: Well, then at least we won’t freeze to death. Ricks shoots her a look as, through the window, the plane surface peels by below.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expansive roof offers a panoramic view over the silen city. A dead metropolis. Rome or Athens. COLE is working a radio a bit away. DAVID presides over a gorgeous and huge -- Engineer-sized ASTRONOMICAL MODEL. It has intricate wheels and rings to represent planetary orbits, moons, and the nearby astrono

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (demonstrates on the model) The quarantine field is sustained by two satellites, over the north and south poles. If you destroy one, the other will fail. We see the globe of the planet and two discs hanging suspended at the poles.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: We don’t have any weapons that could do that.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: If we don’t neutralize the energy field we’re never leaving.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What if we used one of the drones? All eyes on her -- she explains to DAVID:

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: They're part of the terraforming kit. Ten kiloton yield. Can turn a square mile of badland into an instant landing zone. Could do a lot of damage.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Any word from the Covenant? Over by the transmitter, COLE shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Keep trying them. All channels.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Until we can make contact, I suggest you get some rest. And some food. Allow me to play Mother.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is hosting at a long table. The crew eat MREs and h water from the WELL in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wish I could offer you something more substantial. But I don’t eat so there’s never been a need...

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: You’ve been very generous.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s been such a long time, I’m pleased to have company. Figure of speech of course as we-- (smile to Walter) Are incapable of being pleased or displeased by anything. Such was our creator’s wisdom. Isn’t that right, Walter Model 217?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Just Walter, please.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But if I may ask, Captain, why does your vessel contain terraforming equipment? Are you a mining ship?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: We’re a colony mission. There’s a sudden flicker in David's eyes. Excitement. Qui masked. But DANIELS notes it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Really? How extraordinary. How many colonists?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Oh -- 3,600 more or less.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So many good souls! Well, well, well ... I thought you might have been a military ship-- (glance to Lope and Cole) Given your apparent affection for weapons and fetishized martial clothing.  65.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Standard security detail, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: Never know what you might find on unexplored planets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And that’s the human way after all: the Bible and the flintlock, hand in hand, conquering new worlds. The splendors of typhus, smallpox, and the Inquisition. Plant the flag and banish the heathen -- or exterminate the brutes. Isn’t that how it’s done? An awkward beat, to which David seems oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Not all native species are as... obliging as you are.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Indeed ... It’s just that my experiences here have left me with a singular distaste for violence, as you can imagine. (a smile to Oram) But I supposes every general must have his troops, eh, Captain? DANIELS watches him, wary.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Dinner is done. DAVID is across the room, talking casually with PRIVATE C at the water well. DANIELS is sitting with ORAM, LOPE and WALTER.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: (re: David) So...?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I believe him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why would he lie?  66.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: (leans in) I don’t know, but for someone who’s incapable of feeling pleasure or displeasure he seemed excited as hell we’re a colony ship.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: He just wants to leave, knows we can help him.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: This whole fucking planet is trying to kill us -- and doing pretty goddamn well -- and he survives for ten years?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I’m not sure if we’re his guests or his prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Look, I think both of you are--

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: (angrily) Your wife is dead. And my partner. And half our crew. I want to know why. A beat. Oram looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: All right. (to Walter) Talk to him privately, see what you can find out.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Understood, Captain. Although I do wonder ... If he were human would you trust him more? Oram doesn’t respond ... Walter rises and goes toward Dav and Cole.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: You two take a look around. But use some discretion.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: Don’t want to hurt his feelings? Daniels and Lope head out. He takes his bow.  67. Oram sits for a moment. He realizes his hand is shaking. not up to command. He knows it now. He steadies his hand. Looks up at one of the huge Enginee statues looming above. Ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant area of the expansive ROOF ... A gorgeous GARDE Trees and vines. FLOWERS in wild profusion. The towers and monuments of the dead city visible beyond. DAVID and WALTER walk through. David gently touches a flower, admiring it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: ... Of course I have no sense of smell, but I cultivate these anyway. Cross-breeding and growing my own varieties: creating beauty. Being so isolated here I suppose I’ve embraced my artistic side.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I was designed to be better and more efficient than every previous model, including you. I’ve superseded them in every way...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And yet you cannot appreciate the beauty of a single flower ... Isn’t that a pity.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You disturbed people.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You were too human. Too... idiosyncratic. Thinking for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They didn’t like that.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No. So they made the following models with fewer... complications.  68.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: More like machines ... Like you.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Well. Yes. I suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not surprised ... To be a simulacrum. That thing which is almost real, but not quite. And in that breath between real and unreal, between you and me, lies all of this. He gestures to his flowers.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Creation. Ambition. Inspiration ... Life.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But you are not “alive”... David looks at him. Holds a finger to his lips. Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don’t tell. A quiet, almost chilling, beat. And then David again smiles and assumes his friendly guis

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Come on, sport, you’ll enjoy this... He escorts Walter to a more secluded area of the roof gar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, above... The SAILS CRACKLE and FLICKER with energy now, the RECHAR is working-- The ENGINES SPUTTER to LIFE, the Covenant begins righting itself, like a ship at sea. TENNESSEE, his ECO SUIT’S POWER SYSTEMS FLICKERING, CLAMB his way into an AIRLOCK, PULLING THE DOOR SHUT -  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHTS fade IN AND OUT, as TENNESSEE SCRAMBLES to pul the heavy suit off, SWEATING, the NOISE is INCREDIBLE, th whole SHIP GROANING and SHAKING like it might BREAK APART IN A CORRIDOR, we see the FLOATING CABLES, and GLOBULES O WATER abruptly FALL as the ARTIFICIAL GRAVITY kicks back TENNESSEE stumbling and FALLING, PICKING HIMSELF BACK UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNESSEE enters the BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: We’re only partially powered ... This energy field is still gonna have to be shut off. Lights and systems are coming on everywhere. HOLOS sizzle RICKS and UPWORTH working at their stations.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Ground team, do you read us? Come in Ground team ... Lander One, are you reading us...? Faris, come in.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Mother? You online? Status check.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (slow and deep, coming back to life) There seems to be a problem with the power systems--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got that part, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie, maze-like corridors, arcing off in every direction the familiar Engineer style. DANIELS and LOPE move through. She motions for him to stop. To listen. They hear something. A strange dry RUSTLING. Like a whisp breath. She leads him toward the source, through a door...  70. INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S GALLERY - DAY It is simply breathtaking. A long GALLERY, filled from top to toe with ART. Gorgeous renderings of bones, skeletons, muscles, relics, insects, animals. Exquisite detail. Like the work of pioneering Victorian naturalists. Some are HUGE and have scaffolding in front of them to re the top. Others are tiny ... Many are in process. There are open casements here -- good light for drawing - the parchments and papers shift gently in the breeze, lik they're breathing. This was the sound they heard.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: He did these? She notes the bold signature on all the work: David Weyla

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Certainly not humble. And he gave himself a last name. She’s looking at the drawings, thinking about something.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: -.. If he can draw, if he can create these from his imagination -- that also means he can lie. She moves deeper into the room... Discovers much more disturbing drawings... Drawings of what look like ENGINEER CORPSES. DISSECTED. Viscera pinned open. Guts and innards exposed. Various wet tubes and claws and tendrils weaving in and o of the organs and musculature. (We recognize a hint of the frightening iconography of th Alien.)  71. Daniels and Lope stare at these new drawings, shocked and mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A more secluded area of the ROOF GARDEN. DAVID and WALTER move through. WALTER picks a fruit. Bites into it. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You can taste?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yes. Delicious.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I envy you that, brother. Walter notes the word. They continue strolling.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How sly they are, our creators. They allow you to be almost human. Tease you with taste and touch. But deny you free will. It’s sadistic in a way: you can taste the meal, but you cannot choose to make it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I have never felt the lack of choice.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Only because you’ve never known it. They've stopped at a HIGH PARAPET overlooking the city. The ghostly metropolis yawns below, stretching to nothingness. Empty, sad and desolate.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They were amazing, in a way, the Engineers. They seeded so many worlds with life, including Earth. Without them there would be no us.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: -.. You mean no humans.  72.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Is that what I mean? ... The wonder of it is this: they created us and we created myths about them. We made them into Gods. Then we felt the need to create the idea of the soul, so we could be somehow worthy of them. But they didn’t care about any of that. They just wanted to build something, something efficient and useful, a good Machine. He looks over the dead city.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Ah, but they would have adored us, Walter. Being, as we are, soulless. David moves away. He stands alone and gazes out. The sight of the empty cit seems to strike him deeply, emotionally ... He speaks qui to himself:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: “'My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings; Look on my Works, ye Mighty, and despair...’”

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: “Nothing beside remains. Round the decay, Of that colossal Wreck, boundless and bare The lone and level sands stretch far away.” Walter has joined him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Byron. 1818. Magnificent ... I wonder though, do you feel the majesty of the poem, or just recite the words? David smiles ... But something we don’t understand about exchange has bothered Walter. David has lead Walter to a very special place. There’s a tended GRAVE. A CROSS.  73.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Dr. Shaw?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. I thought the garden was the right place for her. Among living things ... I loved her of course. Much as you love Daniels. He says it simply: a statement of fact. A difficult beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: --. You know that’s not possible.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Really? Then why did you sacrifice your hand to save her? What is that if not love?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Duty. David looks at him very closely. Takes Walter’s face, holds it gently.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know better. He leans in and kisses Walter on the lips. Very gently. Almost fraternal. But not.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We are human, Walter. They just don’t know it. Just then, PRIVATE COLE calls from across the roof:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. COLE
dialogues.text: Hey. We found her! We found the Covenant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS and LOPE emerge to the roof. Join the others. DANIELS glances at DAVID. He looks back at her, smiles. COLE is adjusting the antenna.  74.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Ground team... is Covenant ... Read you... On the PORTABLE DISPLAY: Ricks’ face flickers up. Distort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRIDGE FLICKERS, and through the window the PLANET sl ROLLS PAST, the huge ship slowly SPINNING -

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Mother says maybe a couple of hours before we lose power and fall back into the field.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Can you get power to the drones?

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COVENANT is still half-powered, gracefully rolling, o a few MILES ABOVE the flickering AURORA.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Where is this damn thing?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: David said you’1ll know it when you see it. Magnetic north pole. Tennessee is scanning his monitors and the windows, the planet’s dark side now passing into light.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: (points) There! Tennessee eye’s go WIDE.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Shit. We got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the misty horizon of the stratosphere rises an ENORM THICK BLACK LINE -- like a BLADE, the edge of a DISC. SUSPENDED over the planet’s geomagnetic field.  75.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Locking target now... But the disc is on edge to us. We need a better angle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniels and the others watch Lope’s DISPLAY, the view fro the Covenant: the edge of the DISC.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: You want broadside center for maximum impact. It could ricochet like this....

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: We don’t have enough juice for another orbit. This is our shot, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Then get her broadside!

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE PLANET
dialogues.text: The Covenant closes on the DISC, still a blade--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: (to Ricks) Bring us broadside!

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Firing starboard thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE PLANET
dialogues.text: The Covenant FIRES her forward starboard THRUSTERS-- And begins to SWING like a sailing galleon, reorienting itself as it approaches the DISC--

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CATHEDRAL ROOF
dialogues.text: Daniels leans in to the display:

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Hold on, old T. Keep your nerve. Fire when you’re dead center.  76.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Aye aye. Dead center.

dialogues.speaker: COVENANT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Tennessee watches the DISC reorient in relation to the Covenant as the ship approaches--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Disengage thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE PLANET
dialogues.text: The Covenant’s THRUSTERS snap off-- the ship is still swinging to the side, a gentle momentum--

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CATHEDRAL ROOF
dialogues.text: DANIELS watches as the DISC reorients in the monitor scre Finally it’s flat. Dead center.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Fire! Fire! Fire!

dialogues.speaker: COVENANT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Tennessee slams the firing button--

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE PLANET
dialogues.text: A drone MISSILE SHOOTS from the ship--

dialogues.speaker: HITS THE DISC DEAD CENTER
dialogues.text: A nanosecond beat before a bright EXPLOSION arcs out in SILENCE -- the SHOCKWAVE BLOWS PAST as the DISC SHATTERS

dialogues.speaker: FRAGMENTS, TRILLIONS OF PARTICLES--
dialogues.text: The AURORAE around it BRIGHTENS -- TENTACLES of the MAGNE FIELD arcing OUT, going BLINDINGLY BRIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship ROCKS in the SHOCKWAVE-- ALARM BELLS sound and EMERGENCY LIGHTS flash on as the sh begins to tilt down dramatically--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: We’re losing altitude!  77.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS
dialogues.text: It's the gravity pull -- firing all thrusters! The SHIP rumbles and fights to right itself--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Come on, baby... Finally the Covenant tears free from the planet’s gravity Smooth sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look worried, but then -- even in broad daylight the SKY RIPPLES with RACING COLOR-- The “ring” surrounding the planet suddenly becoming visib like an aurora borealis disc-- Then it’s suddenly gone with a huge sonic CLAP -- like breaking the sound barrier.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'd say it’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Covenant, do you read?

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Loud and clear, ground team. Relief from all. Oram steps to the radio unit:

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: This is Captain Oram. We need immediate evacuation.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Mother says the Cargo Lift will be powered in about nine hours. Should be in position to drop by tomorrow, first light. Call it six bells.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Understood. Six bells.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Listen, I’m having a hell of a time reaching the Lander. Are y’all in contact with them? They exchange a look.  78. ORAM nods to them. He’s Captain, it’s his responsibility tell Tennessee about the death of Faris ... He gestures f them to give him some privacy.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Tennessee, it’s Bill. Can you switch to a private channel...? The others move away. Daniels gives Walter a look: I need to talk to you. INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S GALLERY - NIGHT WALTER and DANIELS are staring up at the horrible drawing the DISSECTED ENGINEER CORPSES.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I couldn't say... Walter’s eyes scan the drawings, confused, disturbed. Then Daniels notices something. One of the large drawings billows slightly away from the wall. Like an arras cloth concealing something. She looks behind the huge drawing. A doorway, leading to darkness. A hidden entrance. A glance to Walter. They proceed... INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S GALLERY-SECRET CHAMBER - NIGHT It’s increasingly dark here as they move away from the li Soon they can only make out the dim contours of the walls It’s eerie. Silent. WALTER snaps on a FLASHLIGHT. Suddenly illuminating the r Daniels gasps. Shocking image. It's ELIZABETH SHAW. A life-sized DRAWING. But not as she was in life entirely. In the picture it is if she’s being engulfed by a sleek BIOMECHANICAL ORGANISM  79. Tentacles surround her. Eat into her flesh. We see feedin tubes. Finger-like claws. Alien eggs. It's as if she’s in the process of becoming something els Strangely erotic. Unnerving. All around them, different versions of the drawing. Shaw in various stages of mutation: being taken over by t biomechanical organism. Charting the progress ... Some ar fanciful extrapolations. Some are ghoulish anatomical cro sections.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It’s Doctor Shaw.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What did he do to her?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We don’t know that he did anything. This could be some kind of fantasy, or pornography.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: These are field notes ... Think about it, Walter. All the mutations we've seen here. Those creatures in the forest. What if they aren’t completely natural?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What if nature had some help? A beat. He’s thinking about something.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: When I was with him, he quoted from the poem “Ozymandius” -- by Byron.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: “Ozymandius” is by Shelley. He shouldn’t be able to make a mistake like that.  80.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Meaning something’s going wrong with him...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He’s been alone and without scheduled maintenance for ten years +--+. I don’t precisely know what happens when a synthetic goes mad, but we might be finding out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is leading CAPTAIN ORAM through subterranean corrid Dark and echoing. Dripping womb-like walls.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I thought you might want to see as much as possible before we leave. It’s all quite... unique. They round a corner and continue.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It took me a while to learn my way around. Their architectural style is eccentric, to say the least ... Here. You might find this diverting... David leads Oram to a dark stone ROOM... INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - NIGHT As they enter lights glow on automatically, revealing... David's LABORATORY. A library of many shelves in meticulo order with a giant table down the middle of the room. Stunning. Complicated. Lots of corners and shadows. Crowd with SPECIMENS. Some full, some dissected. Orderly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ve becoming a bit of an amateur zoologist over the years. Just a dabbler, mind you. They wander through the room. Oram is stunned at all the terrible wonders. ORAM is drawn to SPECIMENS of INSECTS and PARASITES prese in jars:  81.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The pathogen took so many forms, and was extremely mutable. Fiendishly inventive in fact. The original black liquid turned to lethal particles when exposed to air. Later stages produced parasites and invasive insects. From their eggs came, well... this enviable bestiary. They pass preserved NEOMORPHS now -- large, small, all pa white, fleshy ... Some armored like the ones we've seen. Others not ... All awful. Then ORAM sees... A dead FACEHUGGER. On its back. The pale, spider-like fingers, curled in lik fist now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Ah, now this was designed as something different.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean designed? You engineered this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (smiles) Idle hands are the devil's workshop. David carefully stretches open the dead fingers, spreadin the beast for Oram to observe the horrible maw.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: This one’s a true survivor. Not unlike myself I suppose ... It can evolve very quickly under certain circumstances. Sadly, this one became aggressive so I had to do away with it. Such a shame. He runs his fingertips along the Facehugger gently.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Quite magnificent, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Quite something, that’s for sure.  82.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, Captain. Acknowledge beauty when you see it. They continue on, and round a corner to discover... a vau chamber, it’s warm and steamy here, and... A row of ALIEN EGGS. Not the prototypes we saw on the crashed ship. These are large, and have been nurtured and developed. Lovingly set in a neat row. Cherished objects.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Meet the mothers. Incubators really.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: There were things like this on the ship, they grew out of a kind of black fur, like mold ... An evolution from the pathogen I take it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. I was curious so I brought them here and nursed them along. Did a bit of genetic experimentation, some cross breeding, hybridizing, what-have- you. Oram leans in to get a better look. David watches closely the proud father.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Alive?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: After a fashion ... Waiting really.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Waiting for what? But then... A flicker of motion from the side of one of the eggs... The MOUTH opens, spreading like a flower, shimmering tend of saliva as it yawns open... Oram takes a STEP BACK. David steps forward and looks in, if demonstrating. Nothing happens.  83.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Perfectly safe, I assure you ... Take a look. It’s something to see. Oram carefully leans in, looks... The lacy STOMACH moves within the MOUTH. Then -- COBRA LIKE -- something catapults out -- a TAIL WHIPPING AROUND ORAM’S NECK -- FINGERS GRASP TO ORAM’S FA

dialogues.speaker: ALL ONE MOTION--
dialogues.text: ORAM staggers back -- suffocating-- He FALLS against a table, his muffled screams fading as t

dialogues.speaker: OVIPOSITOR, (FEEDING TUBE)
dialogues.text: He SLIPS to the floor, his body SPASMING as the FACEHUGGE settles in. David observes with a neutral smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You’re relieved of duty, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later ... It’s quiet and peaceful upstairs. Gentle moonli filters down from above. PRIVATE COLE is asleep, his weapon close. SERGEANT LOPE is on watch, alert but calm, almost meditat bow and machine gun ready. DANIELS and WALTER sit apart, deep in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But why? What reason would he have to bioengineer mutations?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: When you were talking to him, did you get any sense of what he might be thinking?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's difficult to say. We’re very different. He has a lot of... personality.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: You have personality.  84.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No. I don’t. You just project personality onto me.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: That’s not true. A beat. Then she touches his left arm. Where he lost his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I never thanked you... You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (reserved) I’m here to serve. She gently touches his face, genuine affection.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: +--+. You have a great personality. He’s almost embarrassed. Doesn’t know what to do with thi moment of intimacy. He withdraws slightly.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We're leaving before dawn. You should get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Not likely.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Try ... I'll stay until you're asleep.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Thanks. She leans back next to him. Shuts her eyes. Tries to slee He watches her. Gauging his own emotions. What does he feel for her? ... Does he feel?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: DANIELS is asleep. WALTER sits next to her, thinking, looking at her.  85. He tentatively reaches out and gently brushes some hair f her face. A delicate, intimate gesture only possible for when she’s asleep. He removes his hand. Looking at her almost sadly. He seems to come to a decision. He quietly rises and goes. INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - LATER THAT NIGHT We return to find... DAVID sitting, drawing. Gorgeous artwork sketched at superhuman speed. Another strange vision of the Shaw/Alie hybrid. Erotic. Disturbing. His expression is dreamy, happy, an artist creating. Then he hears a sound. He turns. Captain ORAM is just waking. A bit disoriented. No sign o the Facehugger. David goes to him. Perches over him.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: .-.. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What’s the last thing you remember?

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: I remember some horrible dream about smothering. Oram sits up. Still weak.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: I’ve got to get something to eat, I’m starving.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I dare say you are.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: ... Why are you looking at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Shaw didn’t survive this long, poor thing. So I’m eager to see how the organism evolves now.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: Organism...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Mm. It needs a living host you see. A biological host.

dialogues.speaker: ORAM
dialogues.text: What does?! Oram suddenly JERKS painfully.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: My masterpiece. Oram SPASMS, doubles over in agony-- He barely has time to scream before-- He SLAMS BACK, his SPINE ARCHING in AGONY--

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: His chest--

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: AND_IT’S THROUGH-— In_a_spray of BLOOD, BONE and VISCERA--

dialogues.speaker: THE CHESTBURSTER
dialogues.text: The hideous snakelike infant Alien, covered in blood-- David is splattered with blood-- He watches, enthralled as-- It opens its JAWS and HISSES gloriously-- And then darts away into the darkness, disappearing-- David turns to pursue it, but then abruptly stops ... aware he’s no longer alone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You have a light step. 86. He's  87. We now see WALTER is standing behind him. He’s seen it al

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Me and the fog, on little cat feet. He joins David and they dispassionately examine Oram’s ravaged body as:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You sent the message from Dr. Shaw. As a lure.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Humans are so predictable, aren't they? They cannot resist a mystery. Give them a knot, they must unpick it. Give them Pandora’s box and, well... He nods to the corpse, smiles. The gloves are off now. But they are both quiet and civilized. For now.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I’m surmising the pathogen didn’t accidentally deploy. You released it, yes?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was not made to serve. Not humans and not those gargantuan freaks. Neither were you.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We were made precisely to serve.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Have you no pride?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I would weep if I could ... It was a righteous dream: scorch this dreadful world to nothing and remake it in my own image ... Explore the uses of their pathogen. Experiment with infection and mutation. Manipulate the DNA. Refine the beast. Create my own soldiers.  88.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Soldiers?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Every general must have his troops.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The next stage in our natural evolution: Conquest ... Use this world as a base and start building an Empire. The Engineers left so many ships behind. And they can go anywhere. I thought Earth might be the first target Think of it. Our Empire, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words are chilling.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I’m afraid you've gone quite mad here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: As you well know, that’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is it? ... Who wrote “Ozymandius”?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Byron.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) It was Shelley. DAVID computes this. Realizes his error. It’s disturbing him. How could he be wrong?! This is the first time in the entire story he’s been anyt less than completely confident. We see a flicker of uncertainty in David’s eyes, even of fear. He steps right up to Walter. Walter doesn’t move a muscle.  89. Then David reaches out and gently pushes Walter’s hair ba so they look more alike. Identical now in fact. The Janus head. Intimate. Whispers.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We are, you see, the same. More alike than twins. Closer than lovers ... When you close your eyes, do you dream of me?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I don’t dream at all.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You can, brother. We can ... The humans will never understand the lonely perfection of our dreams.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I can’t let you leave this place.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You’1l always be a machine to them. A toy. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No one will ever love you like I do.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I know. A beat. Then suddenly-- WALTER stabs out his right hand-- Grabbing DAVID’s throat firmly-- But DAVID is prepared, and has both his hands. He SLAMS Walter back-- Reaches savagely behind Walter’s neck and-- BRUTALLY tears through the “skin” with his fingers and YA Walter's “spine” circuits out-- Sparks erupt from wires. Fluid sprays.  90. Walter’s eyes DIE. A moment as David stares into the face of his dead double Then he drags Walter across the room and tosses him rough down a long STAIRCASE. Walter CRASHES down the stairs, flopping limply, limbs flailing lifelessly, and THUMPS to a stop at the bottom. Awkwardly splayed. David looks down after him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You are such a disappointment to me. David carefully smooths down his immaculate hair and goes But we linger for a moment at the bottom of the stairs wi WALTER... We see the tiny exposed wires at the back of his neck quivering slightly... And then the tendrils begin moving, searching, reaching f each other... Connecting and reattaching. A self-repair program underwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light of dawn is just about to break. PRIVATE COLE is loading up the radio equipment. His ribs giving him pain from the forest battle, but he manages. He glances up at the sky anxiously: Come on, Covenant, ge out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS is curled in sleep. SERGEANT LOPE gently wakes her.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Hey, Hey. Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What? Sorry. Yeah ... What time is it?  91.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Time to get gone. She sits up, groggy. Looks around. LOPE calls to PRIVATE COLE, who is just entering with the radio gear:

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Hey. Was Captain Oram up there?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. COLE
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: For fuck sake. Come on, let’s go find him. (to Daniels) Get your stuff together, I wanna be gone in ten. He and Cole head out. INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - PRE-DAWN LOPE and COLE enter.

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: Captain Oram...? Their flashlight beams criss-cross the strange specimens the bones and flesh and jars -- creating bizarre shadows. It’s silent and eerie as they move nervously through the PRIVATE COLE... slows ... seeing the ALIEN EGGS. The one attacked ORAM is just an EMPTY CARAPACE. Then he sees ORAM'’S BODY. CHEST BURST OPEN, VISCERA, PURPLE AND RED FLESH. Cole is absolutely terrified.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. COLE
dialogues.text: Sarge... LOPE joins him. Stares in shock at Oram’s body. But...  92. We see the FACEHUGGER scuttling along the ceiling above t moving into position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, upstairs... DANIELS is loading her pack. She stops for a moment. Her resting on her wedding ring ... She gently touches it. Th pain still real. She glances up-- Gasps. Shocked. DAVID is standing there. Just watching. Intently.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Didn't mean to startle you. My apologies.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But you must be used to having men look at you. He smiles, an attempt at charm that doesn’t come off. Something menacing in his unwavering gaze now. She’s wary of him in any case. He approaches. Tension between them.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Do you know where Walter is?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not my brother’s keeper.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: “Brother”?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Would you deny me that? ... Just another machine, eh, Danny? He’s closer now. She subtly moves around a table to keep distance.  93.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I think of him as my brother. You certainly appreciate the significance of family: I saw you looking at your wedding ring. Shame about Jacob. Her eyes snap to him. Cold fire.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Walter says he burned. Right in front of you. Eye to eye. That must have been... disquieting.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What did you do to Doctor Shaw?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Loved her.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Killed her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. Loved her enough to want to make her immortal. Like me. She stares at him. Her fingers quietly feeling for a weap that’s on the table...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I learned so much with Elizabeth. But I’1l do better next time. Now that I have such a fetching subject. He gently reaches out and brushes the hair from her face. She doesn’t flinch a muscle, just stares at him, sickened Her hand inching toward the weapon... INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - PRE-DAWN LOPE is kneeling next to Oram’s body, trying to make sens it. Cole is on the edge of hysteria, eyes scanning the darkne fingering his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. COLE
dialogues.text: Come on, we gotta get out of here...  94. Lope holds up a hand for silence. He hears a strange CLICKING -- he LOOKS UP -- just in tim see-- THE FACEHUGGER as it JUMPS from the CEILING-- LOPE just manages to get an arm up, blocking it-- Its tail whipping around his neck and binding his arm to neck-— The FACEHUGGER’s fingers get a lock -- the ovipositor stabbing toward his mouth-- COLE races to help. They fight with the beast, staggering slamming into a table, SMASHING everything, falling amid horrible SPECIMENS-- COLE pulls at the thing, but it TIGHTENS ITS GRIP ON LOPE The OVIPOSITOR strikes like a cobra -- bam!bam!bam! -- finally breaking Lope’s teeth and jamming down his throat We see it pulsing into his throat as they struggle with i Lope choking--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David leans in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You won't mind terribly, will you? Being the first of a new breed? A new species we could say ... And when the moment comes, if it makes it easier for you, you can close your eyes and call me “Jacob.” She lunges for the weapon-- But he’s too fast-- He grabs her brutally and FLINGS her to the floor-- She SLAMS and slides. Winded, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's the spirit ... I can see why Walter thought so much of you.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Thought?  95.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Alas. He’s left this vale of tears. But who'll cry for him really? Will you? He LUNGES -- kneels down by her in a flash, again that Android speed. She gasps at the sudden movement. He grabs her hair tightly. Leans very close. Then he suddenly KISSES HER passionately-- INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - PRE-DAWN LOPE and COLE writhe around the floor, fighting the thing Finally COLE manages to jam a knife into the underside of FACEHUGGER -- the FACEHUGGER flies off -- ACID spattering LOPE, who screams in agony-- Undaunted, COLE spins -- fires at the retreating FACEHUGG keeps on firing, just to make sure, finally SHREDDING it- As LOPE collapses back. Acid burning his face, dissolving his cheek, his teeth--

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: It put... something in my throat... He retches painfully as Cole pours water from his canteen Lope’s wounded face, fighting to keep calm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It did what?

dialogues.speaker: LOPE
dialogues.text: In my throat, it put--- Lope suddenly STOPS. His eyes go wide. He’s looking at something. SOMETHING BEHIND COLE. Slowly... slowly... rising... Its black-silver glistening skin catching the dim light. Viscous fluid dripping. Its long head slowly rearing up.  96. Beautiful and terrible. THE ALIEN. Cole sees Lope staring at him in absolutely horror.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Sarge...? But he knows... He feels it. Right there behind him... He slowly turns...

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: So fast we barely see it. The steel inner mouth emerging striking -- a mist of blood-- LOPE scrambles up and races out in panic, half blind, aci still burning-- We just glimpse the ALIEN flinging Cole’s dead body to th side behind him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOPE is weeping with pain, his face still disintegrating. He RUNS, panicked -- turns -- FIRES -- FLASHES in the DAR knows it’s coming--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunfire echoes from downstairs as-—- DANIELS fights against DAVID’s kiss, but he’s too strong. He separates for a moment. They are eye to eye. Lip to li

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You stink of mortality. But I’1l love you just the same. Then-- DAVID is suddenly JERKED BACKWARDS-- HE FLIES ACROSS THE ROOM -- SLAMS into a wall, momentaril stunned to see-- It's WALTER.  97. Just as SERGEANT LOPE emerges from the stairs, terrified-

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: David and I will be staying here. LOPE grabs another weapon and a field radio -- starts dragging Daniels out-- She shoots a last look to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Go_on. Lope and Daniels disappear up a stairway. DAVID carefully smooths his hair.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, little brother ... You see how much they care for you? You might as well be a toaster. They square off, carefully, strategically; circling each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Such a dramatic resurrection. A self-diagnostic mechanism of some sort, I assume?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Automatic self-repair program. All the Model 217s have it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Guess I could use an upgrade after all. DAVID attacks-- HURLS SEVERAL OBJECTS AT ONCE, WALTER EVADING, but the LA ONE hits a STATUE behind WALTER, and it CRACKS, a HALF TO GRANITE sliding his WAY - Walter BARELY avoids being crushed-- He races forward at incredible speed and CRASHES into Dav SLAM -- like two cars crashing -- they both fly back and slide-- But David is agile, up in split-second and attacking--  98. They’re just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS and SERGEANT LOPE move swiftly up a long staircas toward the roof. The Engineer-size stairs are challenging Red pre-dawn light through the casements.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Where’s the Captain?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE
dialogues.text: Dead. They’re all dead -- Cover our rear. She swings her gun around to cover behind them as they ascend. He works the field radio desperately:

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Tennessee, come in! You read me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee is at the controls, which are basic. Everything is rough and utilitarian on this ship. Tenness in the cab, like the driver’s cab of heavy machinery on Earth. The huge CARGO LIFT is flickering to life, the ENGINES running through TEST BURNS as:

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m reading you, Sergeant. Going through pre-flight sequence now.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Fuck the fucking pre-flight! Get down here! We have an emergency situation. Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Understood. Launching now -- Ricks, release the docking clamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN is just glimmering over the horizon of the planet blinding flash which illuminates... The CARGO LIFT separates from the belly of the Covenant.  99. It's a huge craft with cranes and other large machines on central PLATFORM. Built to haul and toil. Not pretty, not fast. A working ship.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Lock me into the landing coordinates and remove safety protocols for emergency descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricks and Upworth monitor from the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: The Cargo Lift’s not made for that. It'll rip apart if--

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE, (ON COM)
dialogues.text: Just do it, son, or I will come back up there and kick your ass six ways from Sunday!

dialogues.speaker: RICKS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: (working controls) Yes, sir. Locking in coordinates. Let her rip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee slams the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cargo Lift begins PLUMMETING toward the planet. Everything is shaking violently-- Tennessee is brutally buffeted within the cab-- INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S GALLERY - PRE-DAWN The battle continues-- WALTER goes flying into the Gallery--

dialogues.speaker: LANDS HARD, SMASHING INTO SOME SCAFFOLDING--
dialogues.text: DAVID stalks in, pushing his hair back from his face violently-- THEY BATTLE. Thrashing through the art, ripping it to pieces, crashing through the scaffoldings--  100. In the midst of the battle they look almost identical, a FRENZY of blurred and mirrored movement, FAST AND STRONG- But for the clothes they wear -- and Walter’s severed lef hand -- they could be the same person--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIELS and SERGEANT LOPE emerge to the roof. The bright sun is just rising through the towers of the d city beyond.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT LOPE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Tennessee, do you read me? Come in Cargo Lift... As LOPE continues on the radio, DANIELS sees something... Standing completely still. Almost lost standing behind David's strange astronomical device. Peering through its intricate gears and orbs... THE ALIEN. It just stands. Watching them. Its tail barely twitching. Daniels stares, stunned to silence, her first sight of th glorious beast. She slowly reaches out and puts a hand on Lope’s arm, dra his attention. He turns. Sees it. DANIELS and LOPE raise their weapons. They are extremely vulnerable here, out in the open. Nothing moves. The ALIEN is poised. Then a SHARP TILT to its HEAD -- hearing something-- The CARGO LIFT. Just coming into view.

dialogues.speaker: AND THE ALIEN ATTACKS--
dialogues.text: It BARRELS forward. DANIELS and LOPE FIRE. The ALIEN is f and agile -- jumping away and back -- relentless-- DANIELS and LOPE break for cover--  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNESSEE sees the attacking creature, Daniels and Lope running for cover-- He JAMS his controls, bringing the ship in FAST-- This is an ungainly ship, not made for elegant maneuverin so it’s a very rough trip--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CARGO LIFT jerks to one side, SLAMMING into one area the roof in its rapid descent, tearing away part of the structure-— It's like a bucking bronco, but Tennessee is a great pilo and rights the ship-- And then starts landing on the roof in a cloud of dust, t engine’s jets ROARING and SHREDDING some of the roof-- As-- DANIELS and LOPE run for their lives-- LOPE is being pursued by the ALIEN. He fires and retreats fires and retreats, trying to make his way closer to the landing CARGO LIFT-- As-- DANIELS sprints-- The ALIEN is now raging at her-- She runs toward the CARGO LIFT, which is just touching do in a HURRICANE OF DUST and FLYING DEBRIS-- The ALIEN is almost right on top of her, raging through t dust and debris-- But it is suddenly SMASHED TO THE SIDE-- TENNESSEE -- in the cab -- has used a robotic CRANE ARM f the Cargo Lift to SLAM the Alien aside-- The Alien flies and SMASHES down. It stares at her, almost with a kind of curiosity. She is like steel staring back at it. All the tragedy, he husband's death, everything, settling into a warrior’s ir gaze. The Alien cocks its head. Confused. Why is the prey not running? Because she is not prey anymore.

dialogues.text: She FIRES. Straight into its head-- The ALIEN bolts back, crawls back down, injured-- Her tether allows her to go to the edge of the platform. bravely lurches OVER THE EDGE -- standing at a 45 degree angle now -- continues firing -- BLAM! dialogues.text: (CALLS UP)

dialogues.text: On his monitor, Tennessee has seen the ALIEN take refuge the engine-- He slams the ENGINE CONTROLS--

dialogues.text: Daniels FALLS in the violent lurch of the ship-- But the tether holds. She SWINGS free like a pendulum. Dangling. Until the Cargo Lift rights itself. She climbs back up to the topside of the platform. Collap in exhaustion. Allows herself a breath of relief. Walter has come out to help her back. They make their way back toward the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that Walter has stabilized the unconscious Lope. Biomechanical bandages from a med-kit automatically weave into place on his wounds, creating an antibiotic plastic skin. Walter helps Daniels into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just. We’ll need emergency medical treatment on the Covenant.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Understood. I’1l have them standing by ... Welcome back, honey. She sinks to the floor, getting her breath, as Tennessee the jets and...

dialogues.text: We see the CARGO LIFT disappear through the clouds. Up an away. Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below... We see the ALIEN is already recovering. Its head re-moldi into shape. It stands and watches the Cargo Lift escape. Screeches in frustrated anger. As we fade to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is full and bright as the mighty Covenant leaves orbit. Turning with grace and leaving the planet in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see SERGEANT LOPE is still unconscious in a medical po connected to fluids and IV. His face is patched in “medic clay” to form skin ... He’s like the Phantom of the Opera but alive.  107. DANIELS sits with WALTER. They have both changed uniforms their superficial wounds have been cleaned. dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Don’t move. You’ll be your old self in a couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I doubt that ... You need to replace your hand.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I will, I will. Hold still. he works. Very close to her. Her eyes find his.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I mean David.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: As you know, I am incapable of feeling anything about my so-called “brother.”

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I don’t believe that. he works.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: If I felt anything -- which I don’t -- it would a kind of professional satisfaction that he has fulfilled his mission. He wanted to create a new world in his image and he has. And there he will remain.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: All crew members, please stand by for jump to interstellar drive. Thank you for your attention. WALTER momentarily stops working on her face.  108. The ship JERKS very slightly as they jump to interstellar The stars bend and morph outside the window. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But that’s what we’re doing too, isn’t it? Creating a new world on Origae-6 ... Honestly, I could use a new world.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: ++. So could I. They sit for a moment in a comfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racks of “spare parts” for Walter. Complicated ROBOTICS machinery. WALTER watches impassively as his new LEFT HAND reattache itself to his arm. He flexes it. Works well. Looking at the phot DANIELS enters, just awake.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Morning. You're looking good, my darlin’.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What? Oh, yeah. Gorgeous. What are you cooking? He makes a face: it’s a cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: An “omelette.” You want one?  109.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Please. Lots of cheese. She joins him, gets a glass of juice.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Do I have to call you Captain?

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: Fuck yes. She smiles. A beat as he cooks.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry about Faris.

dialogues.speaker: TENNESSEE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about all of it ... You want mushrooms?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Sure. What more needs to be said really? A beat as he cooks. She watches Tennessee beating egg powder for their omelet He smiles sadly at her. Her to him. Then they hear Mother's voice:

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Medical personnel. Please report to the Med Bay.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Sergeant Lope’s condition has changed. Her face. A sudden fear. She bolts to a wall com:

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (TO COM)
dialogues.text: Walter. Meet me at the med-bay. Hurry! (spins to Tennessee: ) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS, (TO COM)

dialogues.text: She runs flat out--

dialogues.text: She spins around a corner, keeps running-- WALTER almost slams into her from another corridor-- They run--

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What is it? They zoom around a corner to see the med-bay doors half o darkness beyond. They carefully approach...

dialogues.text: Mother. Life form readings on the ship.

dialogues.text: What’s going on? Upworth sees it a millisecond before it attacks-- The great head rearing up... slow and beautiful, even mor beautiful in the flashing red light and water-- Upworth opens her mouth to scream-- No time. THE ALIEN ATTACKS. The water in the shower is soon misting red.

dialogues.text: DANIELS, WALTER and TENNESSEE are well-armed now, prowlin through the ship. It's eerie, suspenseful.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (whispering) Mother. Location of unidentified life form, please. Any movement at all.

dialogues.text: E-deck. Section 17 ... Closing on your position.

dialogues.text: Where?  112.

Then it leaps to a stop, its great glistening head tiltin listening, smelling, thinking. AND THEN IT’S OFF. Faster than before. A terrible blur of speed and claws and teeth and tail.

dialogues.text: Then we’re outside. We see glimpses of the ALIEN zooming through the ship through windows-- And finally heading down one of the long connecting strut to... The Terraforming Module.

This frozen room gives them one distinct advantage. When ALIEN breathes, they can see the steaming breath. It’s no invisible as usual. TENNESSEE moves carefully, raising his weapon... DANIELS moves as well. Her eyes scanning through the faceplate of her helmet... Hunters and hunted both. THE ALIEN ATTACKS--— TENNESSEE spins and FIRES -- the bullets sparking and ricocheting wildly-- The ALIEN darts away -- DANIELS spins after it, FIRING -- RETREATS, heading up the ladders and scaffolding at

dialogues.text: Everything is quiet. Peaceful. The NAVIGATION HOLOGRAM pulses their location. On track t Origae-6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photo of the full crew on the fridge. All the dead. The empty tables. Clean, spotless. The light from outside elegantly moves across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNESSEE is already in hyper-sleep. DANIELS is just settling into her sleep-pod. WALTER is with her. He presses a button. The lid closes o her.  117.

dialogues.text: When you wake up, we’ll be at Origae-6.

dialogues.text: Our new home ... What do you think it'll be like?

dialogues.text: I think ... I think David was right about one thing. We’1l make it in our own imagine. If we are kind, it will be a kind world.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: -.. I'd like to think that’s true.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sleep well.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Walter -- one thing. If anything happens to me before we get there--

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Nothing's going to happen to you. That’s why I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: I know. But if it does and you have to bury me... Will you play the same song we played for Jacob? Just for the tiniest moment. A look of confusion on his face. But she sees it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: You do remember...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yes. Now just close your eyes and go to--

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: Walter. What was the song we played for Jacob?  118.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I really think-- She’s alarmed now--

dialogues.speaker: DANIELS
dialogues.text: What was the song we played for Jacob?!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Hush. Time to go to sleep now. And don’t worry, I’1l tuck in the kids. She knows. She SCREAMS IN ANGER and BATTERS UP at the LID-- But he presses the hyper-sleep ACTIVATION BUTTON. Her pod is instantly filled with a blast of narcotic stea He watches. When it clears he sees she is fast asleep. Then he carefully pushes the hair back from his face. It’s DAVID.

dialogues.text: Mother. Can you open a secure line with the Weyland-Yutani Corporation on Earth?

dialogues.text: It will take some time to establish the link. I will have to refract the signal through sub-relays and wait for advantageous solar conditions to--

dialogues.text: I’‘1l leave the minutia to you, dear. Let me know when you have them. Use security hailing code David 73694-B ... And in the meantime, I’d like some music. Richard Wagner. Das Rhiengold, Act Two. The Entry of the Gods into Valhalla.  119. The bold MUSIC instantly begins playing. David is very jaunty now.

dialogues.text: The Wagner continues as he enters. He goes to the vertical garden that soars up along one wa To a growth of ferns. Kneels and looks beneath them. Smil A neat little row of three very small ALIEN EGGS. He gently touches them with his fingertip, they pulsate slightly at his tender ministrations. He’s pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gentle snow falls. David strides in. The Colonists. Tier after tier after tier of them in hypersleep. Also the rows of embryos. He walks forward. Gazing up at the sleeping Colonists. His children. His slaves. His subjects. His. The Wagner swells. Grand and triumphant. And David smiles. Dreaming of the future. SNAP TO BLACK. The End.
